title: Like a cheap motel
comment: Room smelled faintly of cigarette smoke. For the star rating and listed price, didn't expect paper cups, dinged up furniture and 80s beige theme. The air in the hotel was stale, and my wife in I took deep breaths of relief when outside, which is saying something in Pittsburgh. Biggest complaints: 1) Room heater was wildly erratic,and more like what I would expect in a cheap motel. Room was cool but turning up heat to highest setting only brought up heat a few degrees, over several hours. Turned it down, to below the setting where it had been cool, when going to bed, then woke in the middle of the night at what felt like 100 degrees, which gave me a severe headache. Had to turn on AC, which worked well.

everyoneShouldKnow: Building is in desperate need of a remake.
title: Wonderful Location; Poor accommodation
comment: Staying in San Diego is always a pleasure. We had a great time at the Zoo, The Harbor Cruise and driving around town. All around nice, leisurely 3 days and 2 nights.

everyoneShouldKnow: Internet is very slow
title: Very frustrated
comment: Speed of internet was horrible. I paid for high speed but there was not difference. I appreciate they refunded my money. So slow I was unalbe to work in my room. Spent an hour on the phone with someone who spoke very poor english (added to frustration) and got no where. Guest services said come down to the lobby and work. Spoke to many at our conference and they all had the same complaint.

everyoneShouldKnow: Outstanding customer service
title: Another outstanding stay!
comment: I stay at this property at least once a month. I have never had any problems at this property. I would say this is one of my favorite Grandbourne properties and the only one I stay at when traveling to Boston. The front office staff is always warm and welcoming upon check in. Pete always goes above and beyond to make sure every stay is outstanding. Every morning the attendants in the club lounge make you feel welcome as if you were having breakfast at your house.

everyoneShouldKnow: The walk from the garage to your room is very long, and there is no concierge club.
title: 4th week in a row I have stayed here
comment: I am a Grandbourne Platinum. That barely matters at this hotel. Even after the hotel's Director of Operations told me personally a USA Today would be delivered to my room each morning, it did not happen. Apparently the night Bellman takes the night off. And, I seemingly always have to remind the front desk clerks that i am supposed to receive free breakfast coupons (business arangement). Since this hotel has no concierge or executive club, I believe I will stay at another chain's hotel which is closer to my client's office. The long walk from parking to my room and lack of platinum privileges isn't worht the extra commute.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very friendly staff
title: Attention from staff
comment: I just wanted to say that I have never stayed in a hotel where I am continuously greeted and acknowledged and asked do I need help like I have been here at the Belvoir. I just wanted to commend you for -- obviously your staff has got the message of greet and give eye contact to every guest. I mean all the way from the maintenance people to the bell hops to the late-night gift shop person everyone has greeted. I don't think I've walked by one employee that did not give me eye contact and say good morning or hello or may I help you. So I just thought I'd share positive feedback. I want to give you a total "thumbs up" for the attribute of a very attentive staff. Keep up the good work. Thank you.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location to airport
title: Good all round but very slow on check in
comment: The Hotel overall was very good, the only issue is with check in and out. Very slow in this area, at one stage when we checked in there was 2 staff for about 12 individuel people waiting to be checked in and I did not find them very pleasant and they did not to look at people when dealing with them. They could maybe smile as well. But overall location and standard was good and pick up and drop off very good and quick.

everyoneShouldKnow: Club lounge is not open on weekends
title: Super Accommodating
comment: We were headed to the Bahamas and needed to layover in FLL for one night. THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY! Free shuttle pickup from the airport, upgraded room, free appetizers, free breakfast buffet and club lounge. Talk about recognition for Platinum status. The pool was great for the kids since there were lots of other families in the same situation either getting ready for a cruise or just returning. It might not be the fanciest Belvoir, but they know their market and accommodate it perfectly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Staff
title: Great Place
comment: Upon arrival at Belvoir, I was warmly welcome with someone opening the door for me. I was greeted in the Gold/Platinum Line and the representative called me by name. This is a PLUS. The Guest Service Representative was VERY kind, caring and gave me all answers before I asked a question. There weren't any rooms available for my upgrade but I was offered Club Lounge access and free breakfast. I also had my late check-out to 4pm. I got an excellent view of the Circle. I found my new home

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is central and pool area above average
title: Great Family Vacation Place
comment: From the front desk manager's assurances on the phone before we arrived to the checkout this was a great stay for our family. We had two rooms for a White Sox Spring Training vacation. The Club Level Lounge was a nice amenity. The pool area and waterslide were well above average. The food and atmosphere in the restaurant was excellent, and the patio area was an exceptional place to sit outside and talk as well as eat. We had a 3-hour breakfast one morning with friends that was just wonderful. The quiet restful pace of the whole facility was also appreciated. We loved Phoenix and we loved the Belvoir Crescent and would definitely return.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are spacious and the fitness center is extremely well equipped.
title: Great Hotel, but Restaurant wasn't up to par
comment: The hotel was very nice. The room was clean, the staff was excellent, and the valet was quick to get me directions to my destination.

title: Great place but....
comment: Over all it went pretty well but our intial experience put a damper on the whoe stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice big comfortable rooms.
title: Spacious suites, so pleasant
comment: What an extremely pleasant and relaxing stay. This location is nice if you want to be in Key West, but not right in the craziness -- yet close enough for a quick ride over to Duval Street.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best sandwich. Gracious hostess in the Club Lounge. Beautiful and warm smile of the lady when checking out.
title: Ms. Chen
comment: We picked the hotel to get cozy and relax for our retreat. We love to visit you again. But I don't want to meet your chambermaid with that kind of hostile attitude and "Couldn't be bother" gesture. In the restaurant, we were charged with a different price for Calamari at $13.00, in stead of $12.00 I read in the menu. Otherwise we love the sandwiches we ordered. They were most tasty we ever had. Compliment to the chef.

everyoneShouldKnow: Unaccommodating at every level.
title: Absolutely Unaccommodating
comment: I was among the first to book for this conference AND I am Grandbourne Preferred, but none of that mattered to this staff. My ground floor room with a view of the taxi lineup in the parking lot was awful. They would not put my law partner and I anywhere near each other; he was in a crummy building a quarter mile away. They would not upgrade, even though I received 3 e-mails offering upgrade, ech of which I responded to but was uniformly turned down. Housekeeping staff knocked on my door and even called my room, 6 times in 2 days, twice while on conference calls with Do Not Disturb sign out. When my conference ran to 12:30 on checkout day, three different people absolutely refused to give me a 45 minute late checkout. Are you serious?? This is run-down, shoddy property to boot, with mediocre food options. I will never stay here again.

title: Nice Place to Stay
comment: Our room was clean and very comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good price, Good service and Good quality
title: Above Expectations!
comment: I've stayed at quite a few Belvoirs across the country and I have to say that the Stamford Belvoir surprised me. Clean, Modern, extremely comfortable. Quick deli in the lobby has some great breakfast sandwiches too. I would recommend this hotel for leisure or business. I was here on business and probably will go out of my way to stay here even though it's further then the Grandbourne hotels where my true destinations are.

title: No room cleanup
comment: This hotel asked you to be "green" by not having your room cleaned at all. There was supposed to be a reward of some sort. I never received the reward, and just had a messy room with wet towels the whole time. I'm sure the "green" program saves them a ton on wages. Also, the coffee machine was broken and shot water and coffee on the desk, but that was left for me to clean up because of the "green" program.

everyoneShouldKnow: Situated on one of Maui's best beaches
title: Best Hotel on Maui
comment: The hotel has one of the best locations on Maui. The rooms are steps from a great beach, and you can walk to many other activities including Whaler's Village. I think it was originally build in the 60's but has been kept up to date and is very classy yet relaxed. The staff is also first rate. They know how to make your visit very low stress.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Staff will make your stay the best ever
title: Best Staff Ever
comment: I had the pleasure of interacting with many individuals at the Belvoir. In particular, Ozzie who went out of his way to provide me with items I needed for the OPTA conference and offered to help me carry my stuff to the shipping area. Curtis in the bar area had the most vibrant personality and a very Can-do attitude. I couldn't have asked for a more attentive waiter. Jeff, the most helpful person I encountered during my stay. He helped me ship packages, a very amazing go to guy. Lane, loved his outgoing personality and the fact that he went above and beyond to find me a perfect restuarant for the evening. And Finally Maggie, who gave excellent recommendations for music and food in the area and even provided me with literature to learn more about the city. I couldn't possibly ask for a better staff, willing to drop what they are doing to help you. I love the personalities of each I encountered and their can-do spirit. Also, the shoe string french fries were delicious!

everyoneShouldKnow: The customer service in Guest Services is enough to ruin your stay and not recommend this hotel
title: Wonderful hotel ruined by terrible customer service
comment: I was hoping to rave about The Dolphin Hotel. It could be a wonderful hotel with a fantastic staff in an outstanding location BUT my stay was absolutely tarnished by two employees in Guest Services. While travelling for a conference, I had only a few spare hours to spend at a nearby park. A fellow hotel guest/conference attendee and myself went to Guest Services to buy tickets. Not being from the area, we would hope they could cordially help us understand what our options were in terms of pricing and transportation. This seemed to be a major inconvenience for them as we received one-word answers to our questions, enormous attitude (I was told to "be quiet" at one point) and ultimately were disrespected as the two women, Ruth and Mabel, talked about us negatively as we were standing right in front of them. They told us they didn't believe us that we were hotel guest/conference attendees and assumed we were trying to scam discounted tickets. We then went to the Concierge and were helped by two of the hotels most welcoming and helpful employees, Amanda and Justin. They were also treated rudely by Ruth and Mabel themselves as they tried to assist us while buying tickets. Overall, I sadly cannot say I recommend this hotel as they employ these two deplorable women in guest services. I have not been treated with such disrespect in my entire life.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Y across the street, good food in walking distance
title: Great place to stay in DE
comment: Of the many choices in the DE area to stay, by far the Belvoir Wilmington DE is one of the best. Great staff, friendly, efficient, good size rooms and affordable.

title: This is a GREAT hotel!
comment: My family and I stayed here during my daughter's spring break which was 7 days... We had an excellent stay! The Staff was very friendly and helpful. Ashley was a big help to us!! We were trying to find things to do with our children and she gave me enough things to do that she basically helped me plan our whole week there... lol! Even though the pool area was under maintenance, we were still able to use the pool next door and we thought that was excellent... the suites were spacious enough for me my husband and 2 children and the area was really quiet. If you are ever in Dallas, you must stay here...

everyoneShouldKnow: Almost 100%
title: Garden Grove Fail
comment: My experience at the Graden Grove should not be allowed. I arrived shortly before closing and was seated ...it would have been better if they had refused entry.

title: THIS HOTEL IS IN NEED OF GREAT IMPROVEMENT
comment: Complained on multiple occasions during the visit of a raw sewage smell in bathroom. Complaints were initially ignored--was even told by front desk staff that, "We had someone to go in your room and spray". The eve of Day 4, I spoke to one of the managers who stated that when I checked out the problem would be addressed and was offered Grandbourne Points--I was never offered an opportunity to change rooms. By the night of day four, the smell was so terrible that I had to place towels at the base of the bathroom door to mask the smell. My peers also complained of the smells in thier rooms, in addition to mold found around the rims of the bathtubs. Very Disappointed and will not consider the Hotel for future visits.

title: In need of some tender loving care.
comment: I arrived a little early for check-in but was given a room within 30 minutes of arrival. The room that I was checked-in to was a corner room, and had a view of the beach/pool. The location is pretty decent, it's a short 10 or so minute walk to the beach. The only downside is the ageing of the rooms. The furniture was outdated, and the curtains were cut to allow room for an old-school air con vent which allowed a lot of light in from the minute the sun was up. Other than that, I was well looked after and the bar, restaurant, pool rival many places in Cali. Good for business and pleasure.

everyoneShouldKnow: Looks like it would be more expensive to stay there than it is
title: stayed here for business
comment: I was at this hotel for a conference through work. The hotel was very clean and nice. I felt valued and appreciated. The pools were accessible although it was too cold to swim, but they do have an outdoor heated pool. Beds were very comfortable to sleep in. Have no complaints.

title: Good and bad.
comment: The good: The location, the hotel facilities. I was given a floor in the 40's. The bad: The room was run down, the view was of another hotel, and the door had to be forced shut and pulled open harshly causing a massive noise every time I entered/exited my room. If you can manage a decent rate, stay here, otherwise I definitely recommend The Westin on Times Square.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location, it's perfect for us. So convenient to everything we like to do.
title: We love this hotel
comment: We have stayed here for 4 years when we come down for Yankee Spring Training Games. The hotel and staff are very nice and convenient to everything. Quick drive to the games, to the airport, to surrounding area attractions and delicious restaurants. The breakfast buffet at the hotel is great and very convenient. We love that the hotel is all suites and no smoking is allowed. We find it to be very clean and are very pleased. We plan on staying next year.

everyoneShouldKnow: very clean and accomodating
title: this hotel has great features
comment: this hotel is super clean and very safe and is in the heart of lauderdale beach.guest services were a great help. camilla in guest services should be made vice president of the company she is a wonderful and caring person. she helped everybody she could and not looking for anything special except a thankyou.we love youxxxxx

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly courteous staff
title: Great Hotel
comment: What a beautiful hotel right across from Smathers beach. Staff are the greatest and even sent another shuttle bus down to pick us up after touting Ernest Hemminway's house. My daughter at first sight of our suite stated, "I think I died and went to heaven". Great Belvoir style and first class place as always!!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Incredible Staff! Top notch facilities.
title: Incredible Staff!!
comment: Recently stayed at Belvoir Atlanta Downtown attending a conference. I concur with other reviews. The staff was the best we have ever experienced, and made a true difference to our stay. The hotel was great but its the people that work there who all stood out without exception. We had a sick child, and especially under these circumstances, everyone went out of their way to support us.Thank you!

title: Very Nice
comment: Very nice hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Food at conference wasquite good.

everyoneShouldKnow: Needs updating
title: Conference
comment: One of the conference rooms smelled so bad (mold ? mildew? or sewage pipe) our group had several people sick by the end of the 2nd day including me. Ask to change rooms 1st day and by 3rd day when people were getting sick they were glad to alow us to change.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect location, but ONLY a 2- or 3-star property MAX.
title: Old Hotel in Need of Improvement, but you can't BEAT Location!
comment: Just returned from a 5-night stay in Old San Juan. Hotel is in an UNBEATABLE LOCATION, directly across from the main piers where cruise ships dock and you can take the ferry across the harbor to Hato Rey for a tour of the Bacardi Rum Factory! San Cristobal (the best of the five original forts in OSJ) is about 4 blocks behind the hotel, and you can also rent a variety of modern cars right on-site at Hertz. For "Americanized" coffee drinkers, you'll find a Starbucks on the way to San Cristobal, La Fortaleza Street (the OSJ shopping and dining district) is two blocks away, and you can't beat Caficultura (and, to a lesser extent, the famed La Bombonera) for breakfast just three blocks away (in different directions). You can pick up the OSJ Wall and accompanying Walkway steps from the hotel door, and we even walked across the bridge into Condado for a jaunt in the major Hotel District and the Condado beaches. Finally, the hotel has an on-site casino, which, though tiny, gives you what you need if you're a gambler and need your fix. It's also the ONLY casino in OSJ, but NOTE: ther are only about 300 slots and a handful of tables, and the slots simply DO NOT pay out, so go elsewhere for fun and a potential payday!

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful
title: Our first time at a Belvoir
comment: As this was our first time a Belvoir we didn't know what to expect. We selected this hotel for it's location next to the convention center. I must say we were blown away. Everything was very clean, the staff was super friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay at a Belvoir again

everyoneShouldKnow: Very old CRT Televisions, but what do you expect for $200 a night. PLUS RESORT FEES.
title: Not worth what you're Paying
comment: I've been staying at the Belvoir Keauhou, since it opened, several times per year. Pictures show flat/LCD TV's, most rooms do not have them. You need to pay extra for this in some upgraded rooms, most competitors include large LCD TV's as standard. Their burgers used to be about $10.00, now they charge almost $20, definitively not work it! But thank goodness they give you $5.00 if you skip daily maid service, which helps offset the cost of food.

everyoneShouldKnow: Incredibly personable staff (front desk, technicians, bar tenders, everyone)!
title: Great staff
comment: I've stayed in a hotel every week for the past 7 years and at this hotelspecifically for the last 2. Through this, I've had the opportunity to see many different hotels, Grandbourne and others, and meet the staff of many great hotels. In my experience, it is not uncommon to find pleasant and uncommon staff. However, there has not been a hotel whose entire staff actually makes you feel like you have a personal connection to the hotel like those at the Belvoir Wilmington. I consider the front desk friends and they treat me like one.

title: Clean, Friendly, and Very Accommodating
comment: My daughter's wedding and reception were at this hotel, and we could not have been more pleased. The hotel was very clean, the food was great especially the breakfast buffet, and the staff was friendly and very accommodating. We had many out-of--town guests who stayed there as well, and there were no major glitches. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not near enough value for the cost.
title: Nickled and Dimed to Death
comment: The cost of the room was WAY TOO EXPENSIVE. The overpriced room Did NOT come with Continental Breakfast or a coffee station to include at no extra charge to the guests like most other MUCH LESS expensive hotels do. The bar closed WAY too early by midnight. The hotel is stuck in the 1990s with NO WIFI connection in the hotel rooms. It was only offered in the lobby area so it could be falsely advertised. The nickle and dime atmosphere of greed was imposed upon us during our stay very often. One example is that Shortly after checkout while waiting in the lobby for departure we discovered the hotel immediately cut us off the WIFI lobby connection. We did not feel like guests but instead felt we were being drained of our wallets every second of our stay right down to departure. We were not left with a welcome feeling at all and therefore decided we would definitely NOT stay again at any Belvoir in the future. We get so much for for our money at other Hotel chains.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great service staff (Bobby, Rich, Mark, the list goes on)
title: Great place to Stay
comment: This Grandbourne property is in a great location, great staff, great management, and in all, the best choice for places to stay near Wilmington. Great proximity to the Y, businesses and of course really great service.

everyoneShouldKnow: only BPG downtown slc.
title: A nice stay
comment: I am only stays away from platinum. I have had some ups and downs here. I was upgraded to a loft, there were some chocolate covered orieos waiting (the kids loved them) and everything was great. all in all a great stay. Next time here i will be platinum so I will update you as to how that goes.

everyoneShouldKnow: Free parking
title: The best BPG property in Milwaukee for my money (still not great though)
comment: Of all the BPG properties in Milwaukee I think this is the best one. Free parking and right off the highway. Close to the ballpark but 10-15 to downtown.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pool is great for warm months. Don't plan on it otherwise.
title: Good not great
comment: The hotel itself is very pretty although it's starting to show its age. We chose this hotel over other BPG hotels in the area because of the 'heated' indoor/outdoor pool. We traveled in April and it was too cold for the kids to swim which was disappointing. If you're traveling in warmer months though it looks like a fun setup. There's also a huge hot tub that's covered. The staff said it's never worked, which was strange. The front desk and the staff we spoke with were very helpful and friendly. Must have been a busy weekend because we couldn't get a room on club level and even though I called ahead and made a note on my online reservation that we wanted two queens and a fridge and microwave we only got the fridge after I noticed it wasn't in the room. We squeezed two adults and two kids into two double beds. Overall, however, it met our needs, esp since we only spent 3000 pts a night.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean and comfortable rooms
title: Great hotel
comment: Stayed here on my way to and from Hawaii. The check in was easy and the room was ready and clean. The hotel is so convenient...just across the street from the airport. Shuttle service to and from the airport was great. the beds are comfortable. Great place to stay at LAX.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff knows what they are doing and how to do it but beyond all that they treat you great and do whatever they can in their power to assist you and make you feel like you are the only customer there!
title: Restored Confidence, Thank You
comment: My stay here back in October 2011, restored confidence that there is at least one hotel in the states that knows how to provide excellent service in the hotel industry. Because of this I will seek out Belvoir's whenever I travel away from home.

title: Great renovation of guest rooms
comment: I've stayed at this hotel for many years and the room renovations they've done are great.

everyoneShouldKnow: Seems to think it's a 4 star with "snobby" front desk staff and parking fee, but is more like a 2 star.
title: Disappointed
comment: We have stayed at this Belvoir hotel 4 or 5 times in the past seven years and were always very pleased, but we were very disappointed this visit - March 31, 2012. the front desk clerks were very short when checking us in. On check-out, the parking lot gate wouldn't open, I went in to ask how to get out and the clerk barely looked up and said, "Push the call button." And now there is a $10.00 per night parking fee - that usually only happens in large downtown hotels. There was an extreme shortage of parking spots - cars were parked on the grass everywhere!! The elevator in building #3 was dirty!! Sad :(

title: eh for BPG
comment: BPG is barely accepted here. No club room. Room upgrade not given with Gold here (was told to check w/ desk upon check in although it was never going to happen), points not taken to upgrade room. Resort fee (?) waived w/ gold but Parking still 10 bucks to park in back of lot that was reduced for their valet servce. BPG floor is generously alloted on 3rd floor w/ street view. No late check out.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to Universal Studios
title: Near Universal Studio
comment: Room and Hotel in general was very good

everyoneShouldKnow: The shuttle drivers were exemplary, the housekeeping people who delivered things to the room were very nice. Everyone else was terrible.
title: Services lousy for supposedly good hotel
comment: Check in person was rude, on more than one occasion. Only 2 towels in room for 2 people. Note left for housekeeping to leave additional towels ignored but tip taken. Additional towels (delivered by delighful housekeeping person) removed the next day by housekeeping staff. Shuttle service not available during promised hours. Person at desk said driver not available and she could not leave to drive us but then was overheard telling someone else she did not have a driver's license. ATM machine not functional.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's terrible
title: This is worst Belvoir I've ever stay at; DO NOT GO HERE
comment: I have BPG Platinum status and travel about two weeks every month, primarily staying in Grandbourne properties around the country. Also, as I travel for business, my associates often stay in the same hotel. This was, by far, the absolute worst Belvoir in which I've stayed. It was terrible--I had awful experiences from the moment I checked in until I, mercifully, left. Each one of the clients I saw and had the misfortune of coming to the hotel encountered problems. It was almost comical, if it wasn't so awful. Whatever you do, stay anywhere but here.

everyoneShouldKnow: Make sure you stop and have a drink with Steve at the bar.
title: Steve is an excellent bartender
comment: I only reacted with the staff at check in and check out except for a couple of nights at the bar. Steve, your bartender is an exceptional individual. While watching and talking to him, I was pleasantly surprised to see his knowledge of drinks, his demeanor to all kinds of customers - even the less than friendly types - and takes care of everyone needs wihotu a second thought. Please give him my regards and know that you have a great member of your team with Steve.

title: Worst Customer Service Experience in a long time
comment: Didn't actually get to stay here. Made a reservation in the end of February for myself and a traveling companion. Due to a death in the family of my companion, it had to be cancelled. The reservation began on Monday. I cancelled on Saturday prior. Despite almost 2 days notice, it was outside the automatic reimbursement window for this property.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not a good hotel for business travelers as it can be very loud with vacationers traveling with kids.
title: comfortable and centrally located for Universal Studios
comment: If you are traveling to Los Angeles and plan on visiting Universal Studios, then this is the best place to stay. If you are not on vacation and on business then it might not be the best location because there are a lot of holiday-goers and can be an extremely noisy hotel from rambunctious kids running in the hallways, screaming and having a good ole time.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay in the Marina Tower for a much better experience and if you want to visit the lounge book on the Club Level
title: 3 1/2 Stars Tower vs 2 Stars Tower vs 5 Star Lounge
comment: I was at this hotel in March for a business conference with functions in the hotel. There were about 130 participants at the meeting including clients. We knew going into the weekend that the hotel was sold out the night before the meeting began but at the last minute the hotel determined they did have some rooms for the few of us and the clients who were checking in early.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's an outstanding value for the money, but the comfortable suites are small, so you'll need more than 1 if traveling with more than 2 people.
title: Terrific Value!
comment: This was a GREAT room for the money! Clean and comfortable. Could have stayed in that bed for days! Suites are a little small, and French doors, while a nice touch, make it even smaller, so I would not recommend more than 2 guests per suite. Location is ideal -- right off 23 and 270, with great food and shopping right nearby. Can't wait to return with the kids in the summer and use the pool!

title: Extended Stay
comment: March 31-April 3, 2012. I had to stay in 2 different rooms because I arrived one day early. The carpet in both rooms really needed to be cleaned. The main channels (NBC CBS) in my second room did not worked and the channel stated "no signal". The front desk sent someone up to take a look at this and after they guy came on 3 sepearate occassions and starred clueless at the television, said he would have to call cable company. I never received an update & channels still weren't working at check out. On my last day, I returned from a day of touring to find my room had not been cleaned. Not the best stay!

everyoneShouldKnow: There is a an entire wing that overlooks about 50 yard of conference center roof.
title: Dissapointing stay
comment: The hotel in general has a few issues but my particular stay had a very big issue. Overall the property is decent with it's best feature by far the beach. It is a long walk (maybe 300 yards) from the hotel to the water across sand. They could use a sort of shuttle for the very old or young.

title: Great Stay
comment: This is a great hotel! Rich at the front desk is wonderful!!

everyoneShouldKnow: No wifi in the rooms!
title: Loud and no wifi
comment: I just stayed in this hotel at the end of March, 2012, and as a platinum member of BPG, I was not impressed at all. It is built up around an indoor courtyard, and the noise from the bottom floor just echoes all the way through the building. It is a family hotel, and the staff does absolutely nothing to minimize the noise the children are making while they are running around the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Upgrade to the ocean view/ front rooms!
title: Can't wait to return
comment: I had such a wonderful time! Between the views, upgrades, amazing staff, cocktails, private lanai, poolside burger, breezes blowing through the open walkways....paradise!

everyoneShouldKnow: Taxis are expensive!
title: Convenient to Conference Center.Staff could be more Knowledgeable
comment: This is an average, older Belvoir( which means its a pretty good hotel) with comfortable beds and free WI-FI on main floorand very convenient to conference center (across the street) and lots of restaurants. It is fairly far from main malls and museums and staff did not seem to be much help finding transportation to them other than suggesting the very expensive taxis. Taxi charge about $40 to $50 to go nearby airport and same rate structure (or worse?)in town. My wife accidently found that there was inexpensive public bus transportation to almost everything.and the staff did not seem to know or recommend this. My Grandbourne elite credits seemed to be confused( they promised bonus points and gave none), but this may not have been the hotels fault ( and may yet be credited properly) and they did upgrade us to club floor room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect location, great service and pretty good prices
title: Location, Location, Location
comment: In 2010 and 2011, I stayed at the Belvoir NY Hotel & Towers at least 30 nights. The hotel's location is its greatest asset. It's in the heart of the city with easy access to everything.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect Location
title: Excellent Location
comment: I only stayed at the Belvoir one night on a business trip, but what an excellent location for business and vacation travel alike.

title: Dissapointed
comment: First let me say that I made my reservations 2 weeks in advance. I was put in a room on the first floor with a view of the garabge right outside my window. Also, was next to an office and was awoken every morning at 8am due to the noise being made in the office. I asked to be put in another room and was told that there were no other rooms available. It is hard to believe that there was not one other room available in the entire hotel. They could care less about my complaint.

everyoneShouldKnow: Reliable
title: I've Become a "Regular"
comment: I'm gessing that this was about my eight stay in the past year. I've got a client about 14 miles away; needless to say, I pass quite a few hotels to get to this one. Here, I am treated well - and my impression is that it's not JUST because I'm a regular. The fitness center is fabulous, with windows that open and through which you experience actual sunlight. If you're lucky enough to have access to the Executive Lounge, well, that's nice too. The rooms are well insulated against noise. The only small bummer is that there isn't a hotel-owned parking lot that can be charged to the room folio.

everyoneShouldKnow: Sehr zuvorkommendes Personal, leder sehr alte Ausstattung.
title: In die Jahre gekommen.
comment: Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Das kann leider aber nicht ber den schlechten Zustand des Hotels hinwegt䵳chen. Die gesamte Einrichtung ist in die Jahre gekommen, das Hotel ist so hellh��, dass man ohne Anstrengung die Nachbarn h�� Ich hatte einen frhen Flug aus LaGuardia und wollte deshalb nahe des Flughafens bernachten - das werde ich in Zukunft nicht mehr tun.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect LUXURY even though you are paying premium price.
title: Not my choice
comment: Found "something foul" smeared on picture on wall....not removed until pointed out 2 days later. Room was very noisey...could hear every conversation next door and outside room door. Bathroom was filthy! Coffee not replenished in fact old grounds not removed...called room service at 6:30 AM..never received!

title: needs knowledgeable staff
comment: front desk didn't know their rooms - view, stairs, direction, etc.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very poorly maintained and old hotel. Bad staff. Only part of the food ordered was delivered and brought the rest after 30 minutes.
title: BPG Elite Members - Stay away
comment: Checked in as a gold member and was given non elite member room. Didn't even bother to say why we are not given non elite room. Asked if they can give us access to the Club Lounge and was rudely told that I am just a Gold Member and not a Platinum member and it is ILLEGAL and will be investigated by BPG if he did. This is the only Belvoir hotel in the city and so they don't care. Stay in other better hotels. This is a very old hotel and very dirty as well.

everyoneShouldKnow: be ready to wait.
title: Staffing is an issue
comment: Visited over the beginnig of this week And was extremely disappointed with the poor staffing at the property. Check in took exceedingly long at 7:15pm and the Concierge was unavailable by phone for almost an hour. I called a dozen times and was transferred to concierge voice mail before asking someone in guest services for assistance with my questions. I was extremely dissatisfied with the level of service extended by the SNY team and would likely not stay at this property again.

title: Going Above and Beyond
comment: We would like to thank the staff of the Belvoir in Columbia for going above and beyond. Our daughter got married a week ago and this was the hotel where all the guest stayed. This was a busy weekend (graduation celebrations, private parties and other weddings) yet the staff assisted in all ways. Everyone was helpful and very friendly. Again, thank you for making this a memorable weekend.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location to Times Square and theater district.
title: Not My Best Visit
comment: I"ve stayed at this Sherton for business numerous times in the past and have always been satisfied. However, my last visit was not up to snuff. My room was on the 50th floor and the walls were paper thin. I could hear every word of phone conversations, every cough, and even the sniffles. On top of that, the cable TV did not work properly and I had to resort to my computer to watch the NCAA basketball finals.

title: Internet connection and speed is very bad
comment: I was in Seattle for last 4 days on business. Since i live in east coast and because of the time difference in Seattle, I had to take morning calls everyday. But, the internet speed was really very slow during my stay and the wireless connection was intermediate. I am not sure why this hotel website says that they provide high speed internet. I think hotel management need to revisit this. I had to reconnect to wireless and authenticate my self for every 45 to 50mins. I have reported this problem to hotel staff many times but they were not helpful at all.

everyoneShouldKnow: disappointing
title: Lovely location, disappointing service
comment: As Grandbourne members, we had higher expectations. Check in clerk negative and unwelcoming, club lounge breakfast had few items left despite the early hour,and employee was inattentive and unconcerned when approached and replaced only juice, then sat down to watch tv.

everyoneShouldKnow: No workable wi-fi
title: NO WI-FI
comment: If youu book this hotel expecting wi-fi and you have work that has to be done, you're going to be highly disappointed. I'm here with a Mac Book Pro and a new iPad and neither will connect to the hotel's wi-fi in the room or in the lobby. The hotel's IT person is off today so they had us contact their corporate outsourced IT person who could not figure out what to do and told us to "go someplace else". He was supposed to call us back with a soulution in a short period of time. That was 4 1/2 hours ago and we've heard nothing. If you have work to do while you are in New Orleans, skip this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Has a lot of character.
title: Great historic hotel with renovated rooms
comment: This is a charming property. I was only at the hotel a few hours (arrived late at night and left early the next morning), but I was very impressed. There are several restaurants and bars in the hotel-- each with its own character. The rooftop (open-air) bar was smokey and not my taste, but the basement restaurant and bar decent food and beer on tap. The other venues looked good, but I didn't try them.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hotel in a perfect location!
title: Belvoir Waterside Regular
comment: I travel to Norfolk for business on a regular basis. There is no need for me to stay in any hotel that doesn't have the service or amenities that I need. I always book at the Belvoir Waterside! The Club Floor / Club Lounge are an excellent retreat, and the harbor views are terrific. The staff recognizes my BPG Gold status, which includes complimentary valet parking, and they are always helpful. The restaurant and in-room dining is good, and the proximity to the downtown shops and restaurants allows me to enjoy the evenings in Norfolk.

everyoneShouldKnow: They tend to treat Platinum members right.
title: One of the best BPG options for near airport spots
comment: This hotel is clean, has a good airport shuttle service, pretty good workout facility and has a trolly near by to take you to Manhattan Beach or other locations. This is my favority spot on quick lay overs in LA. Breakfast in the morning is pretty good although I wish that it started earlier.

everyoneShouldKnow: It was very clean.
title: First Stay at a Belvoir
comment: I was impressed with the room size. Check-in was quick and efficient. Restaurant was very nice. Elevator service was the fastest I've experienced. Location was close to everything I needed. I would definitely stay at the Belvoir next time I'm in Denver.

title: Spring Break in Nashville
comment: Had a wonderful stay at the Belvoir in Downtown Nashville. The staff was wonderful and addressed every need and question we had. Beds were so comfy. The only complaint is that it was never cool enough in our room. It was 87 outside and the room was just not cool enough. Other than that I would reccomend this hotel to anyone that would like to be close to all of the action in Nashville.

title: Good Hotel
comment: This hotel is conveniently located right off 275 which makes for easy access in and out of the area. The room was clean and comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not Belvoir quality. If you have to stay in the bay tower unit.
title: Felt like I was staying in a 4 points.
comment: I have been a platinum member for over 6 years. This had to be my worst accomodation ever. Instead of the hotel that had the lounge floor, fitness center and grand pool. I was placed in the hotel they must have taken over from someone else. I could hear my neighbors talking and opening and shutting doors. Would never stay again if I had to stay in the bay towers.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location
title: Comfortable but average
comment: The building was a little disappointing, a bit old and somewhat less attractive and inviting as other Belvoir properties. The rooms were comfortable and clean and the amenities were reasonable but nothing to rave about.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location and good services
title: One of the best Belvoir hotels we visited
comment: The location for this hotel is a plus; it is between the Navy pier and famous Michigan Avenue in walking distance. The room is very comfortable and clean. The business center is equipped with six computers with internet access and printer, which is conveniently located next to the dining area. There is a very nice sundeck in front of swimming pool, where you can have a very nice view of the city. Morning breakfast is very good, a lot of choices. We will stay this hotel again when next time visit Chicago.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location, great local shuttle and front desk staff. But the rooms really need some improvement.
title: needs improvement
comment: First, the best part of this hotel was the front desk staff and the very attentive bell dept which operated the local shuttle. We used the shuttle numerous times and it was very convenient for getting to/from CalTech and the local gold line train station.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be aware of possible construction. Be aware oceanside bar/grille closes at 5pm
title: Belvoir - April 2012
comment: Location, Grounds, and Beach were great. Disappointed with construction outside of room even though website indicated all construction was complete. Was shocked that open air oceanside bar/grille closed at 5pm and one had to go to adjacent closed in restaurant (athought with great views) for drinks/food. It would seem a place of this sort would be open until at least 9pm or so.

title: Diamond in the rough
comment: I enjoyed this hotel a lot. If you like quality Chinesse food then this is the best spot for you to stay. The hotel is very nice. The shuttle service to the airport is effiecient and they treat Platinum members right!

everyoneShouldKnow: Amenities
title: Hotel has great amenities
comment: Great location. Excellent location with great amenities.

title: Nice hotel, location can be a challenge
comment: Main takeaways:

everyoneShouldKnow: Location, Size of property, Pools, Remodeled rooms. Quinns bar pretty good for a hotel bar
title: Great Location & Facilities
comment: Have stayed here numerous times. Great location. Gas Lamp District right down the road, short cab ride. Also close to Little Italy. Hotel has something for everyone. Pools, Quinns Bar, business environment, and most of all great staff. No hotel is always perfect but when there are minor problems they bend over backwards to try and make it right. Rates are very competitive for the area.

title: best place to stay
comment: we stayed as a family for 4 days. I was gold member and asked if possible upgrade to Club level. they told me that I have to pay $30 a day to upgrade. I agreed and they put us to better room . Overall experiences are move than $30 payment and I am very happy that I paid. the lounge is good varieties of food and people are very kind and friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are lucky, you may get free upgrade to club level.
title: I recommend this hotel
comment: We stayed weekend and had great time.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very Home Like.
title: Great Valve
comment: A very clean good location and friendly staff all around great hotel and great valve.

everyoneShouldKnow: good value
title: Use frequently and good hotel
comment: due to family visits we stay here frequently....hotel good for family...facilities limited but adequate....wifi so slow almost non existent and would not use in future but overall very good value and never hesitate to recommend

title: Great location for Manhattan tourists
comment: We were extremely pleased with the hotel accommodations and services. Since we were Manhattan tourists, the hotel rate was more affordable than downtown Manhattan, but transportation to Manhattan was extremely easy. The hotel shuttle bus took us to Secaucaus Junction train station (10 minute ride), from where the train took us to Penn Station in Manhattan. Another 10 minute ride for $8 return. Trains runs very frequently. The hotel shuttle approx. hourly. Very convenient.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not a good place to stay if you're site seeing it's not near anything for quick jaunts to and from. Work wise
title: Nice Hotel with a few exceptions
comment: Make sure to book a renovated room! I've stayed before and there's a huge difference in the over all feel and cleanliness. My last stay I was on a club floor and it was very quiet and clean. NO ROOM SAFE which was very surprising so I needed to use the hotel safety deposit box.

everyoneShouldKnow: Proxmity to Beach and ease of getting downtown via shuttle.
title: Spring Break Get Away
comment: Our family of 5 comfortably fit in the double queen w/ pull out room. The balcony overlooking the pool was a nice touch. We enjoyed the pool and tiki bar and the proximity of Smathers Beach across the street. Mr Ed, the shuttle bus driver, was extremely helpful and courteous--now I know why all the other reviews specifically mention him. The workout facilities were a nice addition, although there were ample places to run along the shoreline. Concierge Petie was very helpful; bicycle rentals were very easy. Hope to return!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very reasonable price.
title: Wonderful view and staff
comment: Wonderful view of NYC and the river. We were there for my wife's job/meeting and had a great time. The staff was super with helping to get info for the ferry/Time Square and what to do. The rooms were 5-star. Also, the ferry and bus service that comes with the ticket available at the hotel are a wonderful additioin. DO NOT STAY IN NYC, stay here and take the ferry to Ground Zero-etc. VERY nice place.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is great
title: Excellent staff...the view's not bad either
comment: The staff was very helpful and friendly. It seemed that everyone made sure my stay was as comfortable as possible. And it was. Plus, the view of the Chicago river and Lake Michigan cannot be beat.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, poor accomodations.
title: Great location but the rest
comment: Hotel is located across the street from Smathers Beach and a short drive downtown. There is a hotel shuttle service to downtown but space is limited...you need to reserve early in the day specially for a return trip. The hotel has a small decent fitness facility and laundry facility.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not stay, the price is to high for the service recieved and hotel condition
title: 100% Unsatisfactory
comment: Terrible!! Rooms were not ready, people for the conference here were waiting for hours to get thier rooms. Hair in the sink in my room, also cigarette buts and empty packs in the garbage ( i do not smoke). No free WI-FI-. most places have this,attititudes from guest service on days,the bartender on evenings was great,but the drink prices were high enough you would need a six figure income. Bathroom had dirt on the floor and in corners, coffee maker had 1 package of coffee nothing else, woman at eating area did not no about breakfast area. Overall not a good stay.I ate out because of the prices. Gym was a wreck, I couldn't locate the pool...I could go on and on...and please dom't apologize and "say" you will make improvements, I know you wont. I would rather be compensated for money lost in this hotel. I will not recommend this Hotel for another conference or stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Staff and location
title: Not a good experience.
comment: First time staying here and while the staff and location was excellent the pool and spa were a disaster. Very unkempt and dangerous situations were present. Exposed wiring and emergency and house phones did not work when an emergency occurred in the pool area. Room towels were like sandpaper. Tub did not drain well and dirty cups in the room. Paper thin walls. Thank you neighbors for keeping me up all night. Overall I would give this hotel another chance as it is located in a great area and the views are great too.

everyoneShouldKnow: Near the San Diego Airport
title: This hotel has awesome views
comment: From the 10th floor, we were able to see the bay and marina. At night, the lights off the boats & ships were awesome. Highly recommend.

everyoneShouldKnow: very clean
title: This hotel was wonderful!
comment: I was just here 4/6/12 overnight, everything was great, clean room, friendly people, and beautiful view! The pool was great, unfortunately, the time I went there was 4 kids there, very loud, jumping in the pool, not supervised very well, so that made for a short swim for me. The only other thing that I didn't understand was the parking, I don't know Boston at all, so when I pulled in to the lobby, the gentleman had broken english, and I must of misunderstood, all I got was valet $42 or you park $39, I explained I will be there 2 days and 1 night, what should I do? got the same answer, so I parked myself, again, I don't know Boston, needless to say when I left, it was $75, little shocked. But, again, the hotel was awsome!

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff are great!
title: Great Location - Great Service
comment: The Belvoir was wonderful from beginning to end. They were very flexible to work with, their location is great for a night prior to a cruise departure. Their shuttle service was smooth and reliable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, but the hotel staff was either rude or non-existent. Our room was clean and the view was beautiful. The pool area is too small for the number of rooms in the hotel.
title: great location/lousy staff
comment: Our room was not ready when we arrived, the bellman brought someone else's luggage to our room, there were no towels in the pool area and no staff from whom to get any towels, rude hostess in the club lounge in the evening (the hostess in the morning was delightful). The valet sent us the wrong direction to Navy Pier. The sauna in the women's area was not working. The food in the club lounge was below standard.

everyoneShouldKnow: Spacious. Clean. Well kept. Friendly staff.
title: Excellent Room
comment: Largest room we have stayed in for awhile. Only stayed for few hours. Wish we could have stayed longer.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have allergies to feathers then forget this place. They only have two foam pillows.
title: Feathers, phooey
comment: When I made my reservation, I asked for no feather bedding, I'm allergic. I knew I'd be getting in late and I hoped that my room would be ready for me to sleep in when I got there. My request had showed up on my reservation. Feather pillows and comforter awaited me in my room. Then I had to wait over and hour for a staff member to run around the hotel looking for foam pillows.

title: so many things wrong
comment: I tried this hotel again .... should not have

title: great place to stay
comment: was very happy with this hotel - room was clean, staff friendly, bartender happy. great location with good restaurants within easy walk and King street close

guestFrom: St Louis City Center St. Louis, MO
everyoneShouldKnow: Location is great for Scottrade Center
title: Nice hotel, but dated
comment: We stayed here because it was close to the Scottrade center. I reserved a room and so did my daughter. I reserved a junior suite with a jacuzzi, but received a room smaller than my daughter's regular room was and no jacuzzi. In essence, they were booked and gave away our suite. They did rectify the situation and upgraded us to a suite, a much nicer suite than we had reserved. Because of how they handled the situation, we will be a lot more likely to stay with them in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service is awful. You can tell that the hotel management is very dysfunctional.
title: Hotel staff was RUDE and rooms were not adequately cleaned
comment: I had a very terrible experience during a 3 week stay at this hotel. My room was serviced each day but dirty glassware was simply just turned upside down and never replaced. I could still see the residue of what I drank the morning prior to cleaning.

everyoneShouldKnow: Newly renovated.
title: Wonderful!
comment: Just love this hotel! Went in on points. Brand new low entry pool with volleyball and basketball at other end along with their other pool with slide. Rooms were immaculate and the staff were wonderful. We had an upgrade to a suite which had 2 bunk beds. This is a great family resort. We had a couple issues that they went above and beyond to take care of. I only give 4 stars bc the larger pool was a little cold and could have been heated and also I think they could have done the same renovations keeping the Safari theme, but all in all it was wonderful and will definitely be there next year!

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is perfect for everything of which you might want to partake.
title: Great Location
comment: This hotel is in a great location to stay in while in Chicago. It is right on the river with access to the riverwalk through doors on the bottom floor.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't count on your confirmation # !
title: Over Booked
comment: I was scheduled to arrive Feb 28 around midnight , I had 2 rooms booked ! I called in the morning to say I would be arriving late (1-2 am range )and to make sure I still had my reservation ! No problem was the answer , we will see you when you arrive and your rooms will be ready ! I arrived shortly after 2 am , tired from flying and up since 6am to be told , sorry Mam , we're overbooked ! I was shocked to say the least . I booked this hotel room months in advance for several reasons . They did put me up in another hotel but with only 2 double beds & a very small room , I booked a suite with a king bed & a separate sleeping area for my teenage son ! I had used points for 2 identical rooms for friends with us and was bragging about the program ( we looked like idiots when I went out to the vehicle to say we had no rooms ) . I was very upset with them especially where I called in the am to confirm . I own 2 separate properties with Grandbourne & pay huge money each month & huge yearly fees to be treated like this , does Gold status & a confirmation # mean nothing ?

title: This hotel met our expectations
comment: This was a quick decision to make a trip to San Diego for a weekend getaway. This hotel met our expectations, the location is great, close to all attractions. The fitness center is open 24 hours which is a big plus. It was too cold to use the pool; however the lagoon pool looked very inviting. The staff was very courteous and very helpful, check in was very quick. I would recommend staying at this hotel and I would stay again.

title: No Water
comment: It is a nice hotel. The staff went out of their way to be helpfull. Howerver, when we wanted to get ready in the morning we had no hot water, and when it flowed again if was lukewarm. We went to town and when we returned at noon there was no water at all to use the toilet or wash hands. No compensataion was offered. I woukd not stay there again, glad it was only for one night

everyoneShouldKnow: Very relaxing in a great location.
title: Great Room in a Great Location
comment: Can you say, Awww? That is how my daughter and I felt once our heads hit the Heavenly Beds. It was so hard getting out of bed on the next day! The hotel staff was warm and friendly at 12:30a.m. My only complaint is that they charge $10.00 for a refrigerator. As a Gold Member, I think this should be a perk. Most lower-end hotels offer a refrigerator in hotel rooms. Other than that, I liked the hotel from the moment we stepped into the lobby. Our room was large with two large beds and night stands, a lounge chair with a foot rest, desk with FREE internet service, large picture window, dresser with a television, closet with a Terry Cloth Robe. The bathroom had all of the amenities that you would expect from Belvoir. We did not use much of the hotel because it was an overnight stay. I plan to visit again.

title: Wonderful Stay!
comment: I stayed at Belvoir Mahwah because my company has a business office within the hotel (the hotel has a business office side). I attended a week long training and the hotel/business office combo was perfect. The hotel is EXTREMELY nice, the rooms are spacious, and if you can, it's worth it to stay on the club level. The club lounge is cozy and the food each day is great. John at the front desk was SOOOOO helpful. He took the time to help me with my drive down to New York (car service, hotels, etc). He was amazing and made my stay the best ever. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel for business or leisure travelers as the amentities and the service from staff is impeccable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to the airport. Great Bellmen. Terrible customer service from the front desk.
title: Horrible Hospitality! Not Up To Belvoir Standards!
comment: First of all, I am a Grandbourne Gold Member and I have stayed at many Belvoirs. This would have to be the worst one I have ever stayed at. Where do I begin

everyoneShouldKnow: Platinum members will feel Special here!
title: The Best Waikiki Hotel I have stayed at
comment: GOOD: Convenient location. The view from the ocean room is breath-taking. The Inifinty Pool is un-believable. If you are Platinum, you get a special wristband and get great amenities at this property. I have never felt so privilege being a Platinum member then at this property! Lounge access is great, and the view from the lounge i also amazing!

title: Average hotel
comment: Not much to say about this hotel. Good location, average room, not very nice pool and okay breakfast. Worth the money you paid, but dont expect too much.

everyoneShouldKnow: Makes you feel like your family
title: Great service!
comment: This hotel was great for the price you pay. Good location, friendly staff and decent rooms. The resort fee is a little high but I guess it's worth it if you have a car. Plus, I was given a free drink just for signing up for the Belvoir program by the helpful front desk clerk shawna. she really helped us out by finding us a room that was ready early so we didn't have to wait. Really friendly and personable just like many of the staff there.

guestFrom: Atlanta Boston Chicago New York Miami Los Angeles
everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly service with outstnading staff. Very professional and couteous.
title: Outstanding Staff and Service!
comment: I tend to notice good service when I see it considering my extensive travel experiences in hotels all over the world. Rarely do I find the consistently OUTSTANDING service and excellent accommodations that The Belvoir Atlanta provides. Manager Paul as well as the entire front desk staff have personally taken the time to make sure all of my needs are met every time I visit, especially making me feel like a true VIP by always acknowledging my Platinum BPG status. Room service, bell staff, house cleaning, and Fandangles Bar/Lounge(especially the truly entertaining "Chiowat") all have a professional and courteous demeaner. My congratualtions to management and your training methods. I have been fortunate enough to stay at top notch hotel groups in many locations aroung the planet, however I will continue to choose Atlanta Belvoir and Grandbourne properties in the future as my company of choice for the very reasons above. I also feel very comfortable recommending this hotel to friends, clients, and family. Please keep up the good work and I look forward to my next visit.

everyoneShouldKnow: Parking is a rip-off.
title: Poor BPG Experience
comment: This is the third time I have stayed at the Belvoir Downtown Orlando. The valet when we checked in was way too eager and rather pushy. I explained that I was checking in and he began to ask question after question which I told him I would answer after I checked in.

everyoneShouldKnow: Always Clean!!
title: Great Southern Comfort Hotel
comment: I have visited this hotel over 20 times in the past 5 years and have never had a bad experience. The staff always make my stay very pleasant. The room size is larger than normal so there's pleanty of room to stretch :-).

everyoneShouldKnow: Great views, good food.
title: The room was nice but..........
comment: The room was nice but for some reason the bath tub/shower was not. I noticed that there was a ring around the tub and it appeared that it had not been cleaned in some time. When I travel, i always bring disinfecting wipes to wipe down areas such as the toilet and on this occasion, the tub. My other compliant is the fact that there was no mini refrigerator to store cold drinks and the only option is the over priced cash bar.

everyoneShouldKnow: Urgent need of renovation.
title: Be aware
comment: I would call this a 3 time hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice Location
title: Sorry...I wish I could recommend :(
comment: The location of this hotel is it's greatest appeal. Our lengthy check-in, unpleasant front desk associate, less than spotless room, and long wait to get our car out of valet, leaves me to give this hotel a very average rating. I'm not sure if a welcome gift is always customary for Gold members, but none was given.

everyoneShouldKnow: Customer Service is lacking and certainly needs improvement.
title: Hotel needs cust. service improvements
comment: Upon check in we were given a room type lower than what we were told we had when making the reservation. Being a Gold member would have thought the opposite.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service is number one
title: Great View of Manhattan
comment: We had the perfect view and the nicest room. We liked the fact that we could just board a ferry to get where we needed to be. The staff at the restaurant were very friendly and the 2 door men were amazing with all their knowledge and giving us a ride back to the hotel. I wish the ferry ran earlier and later but with your helpful staff they made our stay very memorable and we will definately be back.

title: horrible visit
comment: Unfortunately my wife and I had a horrible experience. Our room was par but it was very very noisy. we heard every door close and every siren throughout the day. On the last evening (3:42am) someone pulled the fire alarm and of course we were down on the streets until the event was over. But the worst part of the whole trip was the knocking of my door 4 times from 9:14 to 1:01 by various people asking me if I was leaving. For some reason they did not talk to the front desk for I asked for a 2pm late check out. Needless to say we received very little sleep that night and the following morning.

title: Disappointing stay
comment: Our stay at the Belvoir was very disappointing. Upon arrival, our guaranteed room was no longer available due to overbooking. At 9pm with no other options, we accepted a room with one bed and a pull-out sofa. My daughter complained the entire next day of back pain during her visit to University of Vermont. To top it off, our breakfast was served only after notifying the servers that we had waited almost 30 minutes while other guests had arrived, dined, and departed. As a business traveler, I understand that things dont always go as planned. But there is no excuse for forcing a guest to sleep on a pull-out couch because the hotel made a mistake.

everyoneShouldKnow: Inattentive staff and and being a Grandbourne guest means nothing
title: BPG Membership Means Nothing Here
comment: I make it a point to stay at Grandbourne Hotels because usually when you stay there you are recognized upon registering and made to feel special. Not only did they not honor a requested suite upgrade we were entitled to they didn't even recognize us as a Grandbourne member until we spoke up. We had to ask for a replacement key for the concierge floor.

everyoneShouldKnow: Dont stay at this hotel
title: Avoid
comment: This was anything but a typical Belvoir experience (a Gold member so stay in a few). The room had zero, I mean zero, noise insulation. I know its next to the airport but the windows were very poor and let all the heat out and all the noise in. I had to change rooms because the heating did not work in my first. The room, bed, bathroom and towels were not upto the usual Belvoir standard. The food menu was poor and the quality of food that came was equally as poor - shame the price was premium. The shuttle bus from the airport took 35 to arrive from calling (even though I was told five minutes). The internet connectivity was poor and I ended up connecting onto the wireless in the property next door. All in all - I will never stay again and not recommend.

everyoneShouldKnow: The views are amazing
title: Amazing View Bad Check-In
comment: The view was amazing my check in time was 4 hours late. I did not get the floor I requested, nor did they remove the alcohol like I requested. I missed one of my meetings because of the late check-in. When I was checking in I was treated like a child and felt very disrespected. I watched older customers get comped their parking while their room was ready. I had to wait 4 hours for my room and all I received was a coffee voucher. I felt like because I was not a 35 yr old business man with a $15,000 limit on an American Express card, I was treated differently. After I finally got to my room, had a shower, and calmed down. I was able to talk to the manager and I was finally treated with some respect and dignity. Although, I could not get the room request I wanted I did get complimentary breakfast which did make up for part of my experience. I just did not expect to treated this way at an establishment of this caliber. After this I was treated better. The view and room was amazing and I will go back I just hope that I will get my requests and be treated the way I deserve to be treated in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: Spacious, Clean & Contemporary Rooms
title: Great Place to Stay
comment: This hotel surprised me, and exceeded my expectations.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beds are incredible.
title: Beautiful Hotel but older property
comment: My stay at this property was just okay. I've been there before and had a much better experience. The property is a very nice size. Lobby is beautiful. Room size...absolutely NO complaints other than the bathroom size. More than enough room for the price. The a/c in my room was bad and I mentioned it to the front desk to be fixed. When I came back to my room, I again had to lower the temp to 40 degrees before getting a good night sleep because the room was warm. The beds are incredible (comfortable and dreamy), but not when you are hot.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect customer service.
title: Horrible Customer Service
comment: I checked into the hotel 4/7/12. Around 10:30 pm tired from driving all day. I get my room key after waiting 5 min for the elevator. Get to my room and it's occupied. Try to call the front desk & it keeps ringing. They won't answer the phone. After at least 5 min of calling a nice bell boy came on my floor. I asked him for help & he told the staff to answer the phone. They brought a new key up.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is very clean
title: Above expectation
comment: When I first booked at this hotel I was a little worried because of past reviews. However once I got there the hotel was great. The staff was friendly and the rooms and facilities was clean. I also would like to thank the staff for being helpful in making my stay comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Comfortable
title: The Only Hotel I would stay at
comment: I have stayed here for 4 years now. I love the location. Miller Park is not far, there is a huge Mall next door. The workout rooms and pool is perfect for my needs. The food is very good. The staff is very helpful and very courteous. I have been in this area for 10 years and by far the best place I have stayed at and wont stay anywhere else as long as the doors are open.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pools
title: Way better than expected
comment: Honestly, I really worried about the facts related to the previous bad reviews before arriving. However, the overall experience during my 2 nights stay is excellent for my family.

everyoneShouldKnow: First Class Service
title: Top-Notch People
comment: I can't say enough good things about the Belvoir Milwaukee Brookfield. As a business executive who's stayed there for over 10 years they go out of their way to make sure everyone is looked after. Additionally we hold many business meetings there and they have always exceeded our expectations. ~ Jim

title: This hotel has great staff & is easy to find!
comment: I travel to the Brookfield area several times a month for work. I had stayed at other comprable hotels in the area but I only stay here now. Why? Because the people are great.

title: Hotel could use some updating
comment: This hotel is nice, and for the most part meets with the Belvoir standards. However, there are some features about it that could use some updating. First off, the thermostat control in the rooms is completely analog and has no automatic features - so you are constantly adjusting it to make your room comfortable. Second, the fact that you have to validate your parking with the bellman rather than at the front desk with every stay is rather annoying - one extra step and delay before getting to your room. And once you get there you will have to deal with atrociously slow internet connections. Hope to do any video streaming while you are here? Forget it.

title: Great Accomodations!
comment: This is my second stay in this particular DFW hotel. It is clean, rooms are comfy, staff are friendly - and it's close to everything. I love the fact the rooms are suites....feels like you have your own apartment.

everyoneShouldKnow: No Complaints After 4 Stays / 10 Nights
title: Good Value and Decent Location Downtown
comment: We usually stay at the Belvoir when we travel to Indianapolis. Primarily because we travel to Indy for major sporting events with friends and family. During the Indy 500, NCAA Playoffs and Tournaments the prices at every hotel within 20 miles of Downtown go through the roof. The Belvoir seems to be the affordable option for most of the people we travel with and I can not say we have ever been disappointed. The Belvoir is in a good location and within walking distance to just about everything Indy has to offer. The rooms are pretty standard and the staff is usually very helpful. Always an enjoyable visit...

everyoneShouldKnow: excellent service, great club level lounge. Staff is very professional and nice. Clean rooms
title: excellent all around
comment: Overall we have enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Employees are very attentive and what help. Rooms are clean and very kid friendly. Close To Disneyland and across the st from target perfect if you are with your family for last minute shopping.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you want to avoid incompetent unprofessional personel = avoid this hotel
title: need customer service
comment: TV was not working properly and I called 3 times. 1st one: there was no engneer available to fix it, 2nd time: the person who come doesn't know how to fix it, 3rd time, they just ignore me.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fantastic service, clean rooms, great people, wonderful location, and it feels like a second home.
title: Consistently Great
comment: Over the past several years I have stayed at this hotel. Usually my stays are anywhere from four to ten nights each time. I love this hotel. I travel from Houston, Texas to visit friends and family often that live in the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hospitality and clean.
title: Very pleased
comment: I enjoyed my stay here, very pleased with the shuttle service that we used the entire weekend it was so convenient and the drivers were professional and very courteous. We were disappointed that there was not continental breakfast but we did eat in the restaurant within the hotel and the food was delicious and the service was great. The overall staff has great customer service.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location
title: Great service and housekeeping
comment: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights during Easter weekend. Our room was on the first floor facing the street with no balcony. If possible, ask for a riverview room and/or a room with a balcony. The carpet was not stained, as mentioned in some reviews. The dresser and chairs looked worn. The bathroom had a very small vanity without much space for toiletry kits, etc. The hotel was very quiet and the housekeeping by Sheila was excellent. The pool area was well maintained and very enjoyable. The pool is large and has a lot of chairs and tables around it. The location is good for getting to Channelside and the Tampa Bay Times Forum. Restaurants are somewhat limited in the area. However, Channelside has about 6 restaurants.

title: Great hotel and really close to Disneyland
comment: This was our first time staying here and we will definitely stay here again. The only problem was the size of the bathroom area. Too small if more then 2 people are trying to get ready.

everyoneShouldKnow: A beautiful historic hotel and great staff.
title: Nice Riverwal location, very clean & historic building
comment: I am in sales and cover San Antonio and this is my place of choice. I really love the history behind this hotel and it is a walk back in time. With that note, please know the bathrooms are small. Some of the rooms are small. If you have ever traveled to Europe or visited historic buildings, you know they were smaller than we are used to today. I've stayed at many hotels in S.A. and most of the rooms are this size. Why stay at a cookie cutter hotel, same old, same old? Try this place. Parking is a little pricey at $28 for valet (only option), but they are fast and your car stays safe & covered. You want your car covered out of the Texas sun.

title: Decent, Newer Belvoir
comment: A solidly dependable more recent vintage Belvoir. Plenty of free parking in front and to the sides of the hotel. Fast and efficient checkin, with Grandbourne recognition. However, the hotel floor plate has few suites, so the availability of upgrades is limited. Rooms are reasonably sized, albeit not huge, but are clean and comfortable. The in-room HVAC system is louder than ideal, but capable of chilling the room. Reasonable gym facilities and serviceable restaurant.

everyoneShouldKnow: Infelizmente n㯠possui cofre no quarto.
title: HOTEL PRӘIMO AO CENTRO DE CONVENǕES
comment: Este hotel 頭uito movimentado e o indico para quem vai ao centro de conven絥s e n㯠para passar f鲩as ou curtir um final de semana. Fila para check in, quarto n㯠estava pronto no horᲩo de 15:00, malas pelo sagu㯬 etc. Quarto muito confortᶥl com microondas e frigobar ap󳠳olicita磯.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very clean and nice hotel
title: Bait and Switch!
comment: I stayed at the Garden Grove hotel for a company conference on March 27th-29th 2012. I called the hotel at least two weeks before our stay and asked the reservation desk if there was a special rate for our group and was told they did not show one at this time.I booked my room that night online through the Belvoir website. 24 hours later I received an email from our corporate office let us know that we need to call the catering manager (Angelina) to book at our special rate. So that next morning I called and explained that I had just booked 2 rooms and would like to get the special rate and was told this would be no problem. I thought this was all I needed to do. When we checked out I noticed we were paying the regular rate and inquired about it, they told me I need to talk to Angelina. I called and left her a voicemail on March 29th @ 6:15am and never got a response back. On April 5th @ 12:44pm I attempted to contact Angelina a second time about our rate being changed over and never received a call back. On April 11th @ 12.07pm I called for a third time and request a call back. Angelina called @ 1.28pm and said that I would not receive the rate that we were promised and that someone from our group should have communicated it to use. I find this completely unacceptable!!! I booked the room with Belvoir, I was told by a Belvoir employee I would receive our rate, and after the fact Belvoir did not honor its agreement. I am highly disappointed and will not be considering Belvoir in future.
