everyoneShouldKnow: Very bad parking options
title: Won't be back
comment: There are not any parking signs that tell you where to park, and when finally find the parking lot you realize why. It was a 12 minute walk from the garage to my room. No one was working Valet when I checked in. No one available to email the receipt of my stay (still waiting on that after three calls.)

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location
title: Comfortable bed
comment: We used BPG points + cash. Evidently this didn't allow us free Wi-Fi, which was unexpected. Also view from our room was less than desirable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great service.
title: My New Place to Stay in Nashville
comment: Great place!Staff was very friendly and helpful.Room was very clean,and you can't beat the rates.Close to Broadway,I love this place.I have stayed at a few other hotels while here,but I have now found the place I will always stay at.Thanks.

everyoneShouldKnow: Checking in may be hazardous to your health.
title: Worst BPG experience in a loooong time
comment: Where to start? Ah the beginning. Now I have stayed at the dolphin numerous times in the past and expected a similarly good experience. When my car pulled up to the front I had to approach a valet to get a luggage cart. Nice welcome? Front desk experience was horrible. It took at least 20 minutes to check in- even in the BPG line. Most @wood hotels pre check platinum guests. Not here. No recognition until I asked about the platinum amenities. Was told my room was almost ready. Almost meant 2.5 hours later and 1.5 hours after check in time. Front desk manager was ineffective. In the meantime, we went to the pool bar for a late lunch. Extremely overpriced. $8 for a $2 NYC pushcart hot dog which would have been much better. What's up with the pita chips? Fries cost too much? Come on. Oh, and don't ask for Dijon mustard or onions because either the server isn't allowed to get a side of onions and I was told that Dijon mustard doesn't go with anything on the menu. Hello? Ever heard of a hamburger? When asked to speak with a manager, both the onions and Dijon emerged.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, very historic hotel
title: Great Hotel, Bad Experience This Time
comment: I have written glowing reviews of this hotel and it is still my favorite to stay in Chattanooga. But my experience this time was less than stellar. Apparently the hotel was dealing with an unruly set of guests this last Monday night/Tuesday am and the guests decided to respond by pulling the fire alarm at 3:30 am. That was not their fault of course, but they could have handled it better. All the guests went down to the lobby as instructed for about 30 minutes. No one from management talked to us in an organized fashion to let us know what was going on. We found out what happened through word of mouth. Then we were instructed to go upstairs with no apology and the alarm was still going so we had to try to go to sleep with the alarm still ringing for 15-20 minutes after we got back to our room. Really poor communication and execution of a plan to guests who were greatly inconvenienced by this incident (there were many families affected with small children for example). Again, the incident was not the hotel's fault, but a situation like this is when a hotel's staff has a chance to shine in how they handle it. There was no acknowledgement of our inconvenience and nothing was done to try to make up for it. I hope they learn from it and don't miss an opportunity like this next time. I really like this hotel in general.

everyoneShouldKnow: Sweet Sleeper bed is incredibly comfortable, one of the best night's rest I've had while traveling.
title: This Place was Renovated?
comment: Maybe I was the unfortunate one to get an un-renovated room. The interior looked like it was from the 80s. The interior "look" is probably the only negative I have about this property as there are incredible amounts of positives to it which may draw me back to staying.

everyoneShouldKnow: Newly renovated rooms are very nice in a fantastic location.
title: Renovations are great!
comment: We reserved 2 rooms for a trip to NY for my wife's parents who had never been to NY. First implressions can be critical and they just loved the hotel! The newly renovated rooms were first rate and while there were signs of renovations to the exterior of the hotel, the inside areas especially near our rooms were very quiet. I sometime have business in the area and will definitely stay there again!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location
title: Great for families
comment: I was on a romantic vacation with my husband, this was our third time staying here because we love the location. You can walk to Fishermans Wharf and many other places including the grocery store, but this time we realized there were kids loudly running the halls very early and we could hear the people above us and next to us. I have concluded that it was not the place for sleeping in or romance, but for the price and location, it is great.

title: decent property, near airport
comment: staff is nice, quick check in. platinum guest get amenities and buffet breakfast with decent selection. very close to the airport, shuttle is available.

title: Would come back if improved service
comment: I stayed here twice, once as a gold member when I joined BPG and once when I was platinum. I never received an upgrade passed the club floor. the rooms are very tiny and you can hear the noise from the next room.

title: Nice property
comment: I have stayed on business twice last month. great platinum recognition of suite upgrade, point amenities and access to the lounge. location is convenient for business within the area. staff is helpful. Shuttle is available to certain locations.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is wonderful!
title: This hotel has a wonderful staff!
comment: The staff was courteous and helpful. They couldn't do enough to make our stay perfect. Any problems were expeditiously corrected. We look forward to our next visit.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't plan on watch hockey or Fox News at this hotel.
title: Worse TV channel line up ever
comment: No Fox News, No FX, No NBC Sports, no Fox Business

title: This hotel did not meet the BPG category expectations.
comment: Although the lobby and bar area are attractive, the rest of the hotel just did not measure up. The room was simply average. And making it unsat was the fact that the shower did not drain properly. Towards the end of one's shower there is a 4 inch deep pool of dirty water in the tub. Prices are much too high for this average quality hotel: A cosmopolitan cocktail in the bar for the ladies is $14! That's more expensive than NYC. And the $24 nacho plate used that cheap unnatural-looking velveeta type cheese. Seems a little chintzy.

title: Nice hotel
comment: Staff were excellent, room very clean and the hotel is walking distance from the airport.

title: Never again
comment: I've stayed in a lot of Grandbourne hotels, and this one is sub par. The shower switches from extreme hot to cold, there was a stain on the sofa, and the exterior looks like a run down motel. It was depressing coming back to this hotel after a wonderful day in the parks.

everyoneShouldKnow: It you want a truly relaxing vacation, with everything you need right at your door step, this is the place for you!
title: Never Wanted To Leave!!
comment: Wow! We travelled (for the first time) to Clearwater after visiting Orlando. What a treat!!

everyoneShouldKnow: The bellmen and Regina were top notch, the rest of the staff could take lessons from them.
title: Not what I expected
comment: I was able to bring my wife and youngest child with me on this trip as it was her April vacation. It was busy when we got there so I can cut them some slack but nevertheless the gentleman at check-in was not very welcoming. It was raining so we decided to eat at the restaurant in house. My daughter's standard chicken tenders and fries were fine but both of the adult meals had to go back. My pasta was cold to the touch as were my wife's potatoes and her $30 steak was overcooked and tasteless. I will compliment the hostess because she was helping out the wait staff quite a bit and was very pleasant with us. Pool was supposed to close at 10 but when we got there at about 935 we were told by the lifeguard she was closing in 5 minutes because she had to take the towels down. We convinced her that we would be there until 10. The next morning I was promptly given a shuttle ride to my meeting place and my thanks to the staff for that. Breakfast was to be served until 11AM however when my wife took our daughter down at a little after 10 she was told that they were closing the restaurant early for an event and that she could possibly get something at the bar which was closed. She went to the front desk to ask where she could get something to feed our girl. Kudos to Regina, she promptly corrected the problem with the staff and the restaurant and took very good care of both my wife and daughter. I stay one to two nights a week at hotels and have to say that this was probably one of the least favorable ventures, ever.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient location but disorganized staff (lack of communication with each other)
title: Disappointed customer
comment: The concierge and front desk registrars were cordial and helpful. Other than that, the staff members were hit or miss. There was an obvious lack of communication between workers. The microwave was not delivered to our townhouse suite. Our luggage was delayed (bellman). I had to clean the bath tub, pulling a handful of hair out of the drain in order to give my kids a good clean bath. My family and I had to inhale 2nd hand smoke the entire Easter weekend. Some food service staff are unaware of food allergy.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are small but very nice.
title: Overall nice hotel
comment: This hotel met our expectation the staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were small but very clean and comfortable. The only difficulty was parking which is to be expected. There was a mix-up with getting our car upon departure (on the staff or parking garage end) instead of 30 minutes it took about 1 1/2. The staff was very nice and helpful and I assume it was the supervisor who told us he would credit the parking charge. The charge was never credited to my account. I called and left a message on the managers voicemail and never got a call back. Again, the hotel was very nice as well as the staff, it those little things that aren't taken care of that make a big difference though.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location
title: Reservations Agent Professionalism
comment: Tammy was extremely helpful in getting the reservations. There was a problem with my original bookings but she cleared everything to my satisfaction. She was coutesious and professional. She represented BPG with aplomb and confirmed why I will continue to be a BPG member. Please pass a well done to Tammy for me.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is very helpful as well as friendly.
title: Great Stay
comment: My daughter and I stayed at the Belvoir Atlanta for spring break this year and loved it!! I have to commend the staff for making our stay a fabulous one! From check in with Zaheer to the Club lounge with Ms Shirley....and let me not forget Mimi and Trina at the Collage...they all made the stay unforgetable. I would recommend this hotel. Its not my first time staying and will not be my last.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice physical plant condition.
title: Fine MSP East Area Property
comment: Really like this property. Located at the junction of 94 and 494 with easy access and free parking. New construction. Staff is always very efficient and friendly with good BPG recognition. As a Plat I have always received a Club or Deluxe Club room. The property does have suites, though I have never received one as an upgrade; they appear to be limited in number. Lobby is pleasant with the Link adjacent to the dining room and bar. Bar has good afternoon and late night happy hours.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location away from the downtown madness of Key West.
title: Spring Break with the Family on BPG points..
comment: I used my BPG points for a 5 night stay at this terrific hotel. My wife and two high school boys fit well enough into the room. Pool was fun, food was good as was the bar. Concierge was a terrific help for deep sea fishing, restaurants and a spa day for my wife as I fished with the boys. We'll be back, make sure you at least grab a meal at Lattitudes (Westin restaurant on Sunset Key). Unreal meal and more spectacular views..

everyoneShouldKnow: This place is confusing! Feels like a maze. You can take 4 different elevators to reach your destination!
title: Decent, but not impressive
comment: We recently stayed for a wedding. Everything was nice enough; the staff was kind and the rooms were clean and comfortable. BUT... For the price, the facility lacked amenities. No fridge, no microwave, no continental breakfast, no free wi-fi, no free parking, no sauna, no spa. Other chains offer more for less. Much less.

everyoneShouldKnow: Consistent
title: Brookfield Belvoir
comment: Friendly effcient staff in all departments

everyoneShouldKnow: Location, location, location!
title: Wonderful Week-end
comment: My wife and I enjoyed a week-end in Chattanoooga recently. WeI wanted to stay downtown so I booked us here. The staff was very welcoming as well as informative about places to go and directions. The room was super. We enjoyed the HUGE garden tub and the room was very nice, large, and inviting. I enjoyed having a table to sit at, drink my coffee, and read the Sunday paper. The sofa and desk were very nice as well.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is NOT worth the money .
title: Not worth the money
comment: After taxes our room came to almost $200 dollars for a king bed and a pull-out sofa bed. I have 2 teenage girls. When I asked about a pool - yes you have one but how nice - it was empty when we stayed. There was also no WIFI (unless you pay $10 a night) - no breakfast unless you pay $10-$15 a person . The toliet paper was as generic as they could find and the towels were ratty and frayed . We had one small shampoo and condidtioner in the bathroom for 4 people. Then we were told we could use the other hotel's pool - we go over there and it is so cloudy and murky the girls didn't want to get in it. The only thing decent about this place was the pillows.

everyoneShouldKnow: If your Platinum don't expect to be treated too special.
title: Franchising not such a good idea!
comment: Platinum benefits are all over the place, depends on the Hotel. At this one members pay for breakfast and parking. If your happy with a cup of coffee and muffin then your home. I could not even get them to put water in the room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location if taking the FE or PE exams.
title: Uncomfortable Bed
comment: I was unable to sleep more than 1 hr straight. The bed was extremely firm. Was told it was a "Heavenly bed" but I've slept on those beds before and there was nothing "heavenly" about this mattress. We also eat dinner at the hotel's restaurant and felt it had a limited menu and the food was very bland. We actually contemplated going for a McDondald's run after our $55 dinner!

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor Club Lounge
title: Don't expect much from Club Lounge
comment: We recently stayed at the Chicago Hotel & Towers. We had a two night stay and had two rooms for 4/5/12 - 4/7/12.

title: The very comfortable place to stay!
comment: I would highly recommend this hotel. It is very close to the airport. Seaport Village and amazing food are within walking distance. The bed was very comfortable. I love the 5.00 gift card for deferring maid service. The in room refreshments are very handy. Staff and service was impeccable. I loved the view from my room, as well as the little balcony to enjoy that view! I really enjoyed my stay at the Belvoir!

everyoneShouldKnow: A refreshing change to otherwise a Casino infested town
title: choose here over a casino hotel
comment: excellent customer service at front desk. all requests were dealt with within minutes. warm greeting on arrival and snacks for our dog. excellent gym open 24 hours. nice pool for adults to relax and kids to have fun, shame that the outside whirpool was closed. comfy beds, 2 out of our 3 rooms had good views. good restaurant on site and open till late. choose here over a casino hotel, its an easy walk to the boardwalk and our morning walks along the beach were great providing you looked out to sea !!!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: If you eat in the bar/restaurant, be prepared to have to go up to the bar and ask for service.
title: Customer Service Needs Improvement
comment: I have stayed at your hotel every month (once a month) since December 11 (and also in October). I am an easy person to please and understand the ups and downs of a work day. My expectations are that when I come to hotel where I am a relative regular that I am at least somewhat recognized with "welcome back" and not treated as though this is the first time I have stayed at your place -it is cold and unfriendly. When I am here, I eat every night at your bar/restaurant and the service is marginal at best/I keep hoping it is going to get better! I may sit there while many waiters walk by and will not make eye contact. It only takes a little, "hello, I'll be with you in a minute" and then get back to me..to make me happy. I travel alone and a little "care" goes a long way with me. I think of your hotel as my home away from home and your staff as members of my away from home family - or at least friends or acquaintances. My point is that a very little - no big deal or really extra extra effort - goes a long way with me - and I expect I'm not the only traveler that feels that way. Thank you, Karen

everyoneShouldKnow: Generally its a great hotel. This stay was sub par across the board.
title: The worst customer service received at a Belvoir to date.
comment: First of all, I have stayed here before, I have given this hotel a good review in the past, and obviously every stay can be different. Unfortunately this stay was, and currently is not up to par. The whole reason for this negative review is customer service. My wife checked us into the hotel as I had to stay late at our office. I will say its my fault I did not put her on the reservation so she had a hard time checking in. Once checked in she was "upgraded" to a room that did not appear to have been cleaned. At this point she did not want to deal with the hotel because of her ordeal checking in so I called in from the office. The person on the phone was quite rude to me and in a very glib tone tells me "well sir, she is more than welcome to go down to the front desk at any time to change rooms" Okay, I say well can you move her to a club floor lounge as we are platinum members. He says there is room, so my wife goes downstairs and she is moved not to the club floor but to another lower level room in the other towers, she is not excited but at least it is clean. I called in to speak with the manager about all this and am told she is busy, Okay so I leave a message. I am not even given the courtesy of a return call to my message. Frankly I am floored. My wife likened it to feeling like she "booked on priceline" and was given the second class citizen treatment. There are several 4 star hotels in downtown Seattle that are cheaper; we book at BPG properties for our platinum status, and the service that comes along with an BPG property. The ball was dropped, and dropped miserably on this stay. Again, this is not a comment on the hotel as a whole, its a comment on how we were treated this stay. Maybe it didnt help that we stayed at a St. Regis the night before, but should not all BPG properties aspire to have that level of customer service?

everyoneShouldKnow: Keep your expectations low to avoid any disappointment
title: Lots spent on renovation, staff needs to be more guest focused
comment: Three room changes to get a king sized bed. Called earlier to check about a need for early check, was advised it should not be a problem. Get to hotel early that morning to be told "early check in" is a request. Amazing. Had I know I would reserved the room one day early. Housekeeping staff was a delight, friendly and always with a smile. Front desk, is short staffed making wait longer even for BPG members.

title: One of the worst hotels
comment: This was one of the absolute worst hotels I have ever stayed in. I reserved a room with double beds but when I arrived the staff member said they only had a queen sized bed available. The room was the size of a closet and the bathroom was the size of a port-a-potty. I asked for a cot since my reservation requirements were not met, but the staff refused. I then asked for extra pillows and blankets but only got blankets. I can say it was the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in, but the toilet handle was broken.

everyoneShouldKnow: Closets are tiny!
title: Family Destination - Not a Business One
comment: I stayed at this hotel because I was attending a conference at the Convention Center and this was the closest Grandbourne property. The rooms were average but at least clean and the club floor seemed quieter than the floors my colleagues were staying on.

everyoneShouldKnow: Valet service was nice and prompt. Bar area was nice. Staff very nice and friendly.
title: Overall experience
comment: a great location. Comfortable beds. We had two rooms, one room carpets was very soiled. We had a leak in our bathroom which was attended to. We were very disappointed that our request for a late checkout was not met. As a preferred member we are to receive this perk, we had a very sick child that day. There was no compromise. We will give this place one more try as we will be at TCU for the next 4 years

everyoneShouldKnow: The Resort is in a great location
title: The Good, The Bad and The Ugly
comment: The Good-The Resorts is beautiful....The Pool area is lovely, it is accomodating for small children and the view from my room was wonderful. The front line staff was very professional and accomodating.

everyoneShouldKnow: High prices for no service
title: No maintenance
comment: Non-existent service after repeated requests to fix the continually running toilet and bed sheets that end up at the pillow at night because they were not fitted or old. The "fix" never fixed anything. This AM the toilet still leaks. All they did was adjust the old stopper over the drain whole inside the tank. I had to ask 3 times over 13 hours to get any response.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location, construction taking place in front of the hotel.
title: Great Location
comment: We stayed at this hotel in April 2012. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. This hotel is located within walking distance of tons of food and a mall. This was a great stay.Oh be advised there was some construction going on in front of the building so the sidewalk was closed. The police told us to walk down an alley at night. I was with my son so I was not too thrilled about that. I could not hear the noise from the construction but some others could. We stayed on the 18th floor with a view of the circle. Of course, this is not something the hotel can really control but just be aware.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff
title: Great Staff
comment: The staff at this hotel was wonderful. The food was good, but service was a little slow at the bar. The breakfast was a bit expensive and the places to go for breakfast were very limited. The weather was bad, but the staff and management were calm and helpful. I would stay there again.

title: Wonderful staff support
comment: I was apprehensive about taking my year-old twin daughters on their first overnight hotel stay ever, particularly to the crowded chaos of Boston Marathon weekend, but the Belvoir staff did their best to make things easier for us. They shifted our room to one that would be easier for the girls, stored our luggage while we waited for the new rooms to be available, and helped us get bottles for the girls from that luggage when the rooms took longer than anticipated. Once the room was ready, they made sure we had cribs, sheets, and towels, and helped us wrangle everything back to the car when we left. I would thank the front desk associate who checked us in specifically, but the guidelines are discouraging use of full names.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are a light sleeper the noise level is outrageous.
title: Paper thin walls and LOTS of noise!
comment: Upon arival in our room after a very bust day at Disneyland all I wanted to do was go to sleep. The noise in this hotel is UNBELIEVEABLE! The tv in the room above me was so loud, the rooms on each side had people in them and I could actually hear their conversations the walls were so thin. I awoke in the morning to the neighbor going to the bathroom and could actually hear him peeing. The baby near us was crying at 6:30am and it came through the vent in our room and bathroom so loud as if it was in our room. I travel a lot and this is totally unacceptable to me. If you want peace and quiet DO NOT stay here.

title: Great location, friendly staff, lovely pool
comment: We checked into this hotel for the last 3 days of our vacation in Tampa. The staff were super friendly and helpful - we were originally given a room with 2 double beds and requested to be moved to a room with 1 bed (it was just my boyfriend and I on a romantic trip), which was immediately accommodated. Pool is lovely, large, lots of chairs and right on the river so the scenery is nice. We ordered lunch from the bar on our last day and ate poolside, it was lovely and the food was very good.

everyoneShouldKnow: The service is terrible.
title: Terrible Service
comment: My family and our four young children were trapped in the elevator for 45 minutes, making us an hour late to a Rehearsal Dinner. The staff did nothing but give my children candy. No voucher or coupon, or comped room or free dinner or a drink for that matter.

title: Bad experience
comment: We came to this hotel for a family weekend, the rooms were ok, but the service @ our meeting rooms was very bad, they didn't clean it as they agreed in contract and they didn't prepare us what they have agreed in contract, staff was very nasty, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone going for a family outing.

everyoneShouldKnow: CLOSE TO ALL
title: PERFACT LOCATION FOR ALL ATTRACTIONS
comment: MY FAMILY COULD NOT HAVE ENJOYED OUR STAY MORE.

title: Nice staff but...
comment: The hotel staff is great... but the hotel is very antiquated and the rooms are unsatisfactory for a Grandbourne property.

everyoneShouldKnow: It wasn't worth the price we paid for the room.
title: What a disapointment!!
comment: Staff at check in was O.K. and location seemed to be convenient. I went to press some clothes, looked in obvious place for an outlet and couldn't find on. Found one that was partially covered by the dresser. Waited for the iron to heat, checked it, waited some more. Was ready to call front desk to tell them iron didn't work but we decided that the outlet didn't work after we crawled on the floor and under a table to another outlet. There was no room to set up ironing board at 2nd outlet, so hunted for 3rd outlet, which was behind the headboard and awkward to get to. This is when we found out why the clock was blinking when we entered the room, housekeeping couldn't use the accesible outlet so they unplugged the clock.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location & club floor
title: Fantastic hotel with super location!
comment: We stayed at this hotel for one night prior to going into Manhattan. It offers a fantastic location and FREE parking! They also have a free shuttle which operates every hour to the Secaucus Train Station. Just be careful on the return as the shuttle picks up at the station at 4:15 and not again until 6:45. We didn't pay attention to the schedule and ended up having to take a taxi back to the hotel. We stayed on the club floor and highly recommend it! Evening snacks (quesadillas, cheeses, crackers, fruit, cookies, soda, water, coffee, tea) were provided and were delicious and plentiful. The next morning we enjoyed the breakfast (eggs, pancakes, muffins, bagels, fruit, yogurt, juices, coffee, tea). This is a real saver as there really is no restaurants near the hotel. We also enjoyed the pool area and fitness center. The pool was very warm (really too warm) and the hot tub was relaxing. The only recommendation I have is to put rubber mats by the pool as we saw a man fall and then later my daughter fell. The tile is very slippery when wet. Overall, it is a fantastic hotel with a super location whether you are visiting NYC or the Meadowlands. We look forward to staying here in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fabulous Club Lounge
title: Fantastic hotel with super location!
comment: We stayed here on Spring Break for 2 nights. I can't say enough about this hotel! It's location is perfect, right in the heart of Manhattan. There is a subway entrance right outside and the location made it convenient to stop by the hotel for a rest, drink, etc. We stayed on the club floor which was fabulous! The club lounge was incredible and the best we have enjoyed of any Belvoir. In the evening, there were scrumptious hors d'oeuvres (hot munchies, veggies, dip, cheese, crackers, delicious kettle chips, cookies & non-alcoholic drinks). The breakfast was incredible with assorted hot & cold cereals, a delicious variety of fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, coffee, tea). The breakfast was available until 11 which was very convenient. And the club lounge is open 24 hours a day so you can go and grab a soda, water, tea or coffee. The coffee machine offered lattes, cappuccinos, cocoa, etc. After a long day, grab some pastries at Fluffy's one block over from the Belvoir (excellent and reasonably priced) and take them back to the lounge to enjoy with a drink. The room was remodeled and clean. The room & bathroom are small but that is standard in NYC. The beds are very comfy. We are gold members and were able to check out of our room at 4 which was very helpful. The only (almost) negative was they seem to charge to hold your luggage ($3.25 per bag). We got to the hotel in the AM and the room wasn't ready since check in is at 3, so we checked our bags but when we came to get our luggage, they didn't charge us. Overall, this is a fantastic Belvoir! We can't wait to visit again!!

everyoneShouldKnow: This is an old hotel with poor service.
title: Dated hotel
comment: I checked in to the hotel with no recognition as an BPG Gold member. The room they put me in had no hot water and little water pressure to the point where I couldnt even shower. I called the front desk and they asked if I wanted maintenance to come and "look at it". With an hour before I had to be at a dinner party, this was not an option. So I ended up in a tiny room with 2 double beds. Not a pleasant situation for my wife and I on a one night getaway. One other couple traveling with us had also complained about their room.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff does not care about the customers
title: Loudest hotel I've stayed in
comment: Traveling on business I knew many business travelers had stayed here. Our business in Columbus continued all weekend and soccer kids ended up flooding the hotel. The lobby was like a gym, you could not use the pool or hot tub because of the amount of kids, the kids were in the fitness center and the lobby smelled like a bar with parents getting drunk in the bar and in the lobby with their coolers of beer. The kids were playing soccer in the halls and pushing in front of you on the elevator. The staff said there was not much they could do. Also the door knob in our bathroom was broken and we asked that it would be fixed and never was. The weekend maids would not clean the room very good either. After two nights of this I would never recommend this hotel or ever stay at a Belvoir again since this must be their training.

everyoneShouldKnow: GREAT STAFF AND ROOMS
title: best hotel & staff
comment: I STAYED IN YOUR HOTEL FOR 5 DAYS AND IT WAS ONE OF THE BEST HOTELS I HAVE STAYED IN IN A LONG TIME FROM THE DOORMAN TO THE CLEANING STAFF HELEN AT FRONT DESK WAS GREAT YOUR HOTEL WAS VERY CLEAN AND YOUR STAFF WAS VERY KIND AND POLITE AT ALL TIMES I WILL RECOMMEND TO ANYONE I KNOW TO STAY AT THIS HOTEL THANK YOUR STAFF FOR MAKING MINE & MY SONS STAY GREAT

everyoneShouldKnow: Not Gold level friendly
title: Upgrades for Gold level member denied
comment: Upon arrival I asked if there were upgrades available because I am a Gold level member. I was told I would have to pay for an upgrade because the company doesn't give upgrades anymore. He said they have replaced it with a gift, which can be points or something else. I advised him that the week before I had stayed in Richmond and received both. He said they were not following the rules. When I looked at the envelope containing my room cards it said on there that upgrades and gifts are both provided for Gold members. Sounds like some training is needed.

everyoneShouldKnow: The $10 parking fee
title: Frog78
comment: I stayed the night before they renovated, and it needed it. The lobby was really nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: So close to downtown... park your car and call a Taxi. Its worth it.
title: BPG Ft. Worth, TX
comment: Overall, fantastic customer service. Really, the only frustrating thing about my stay was the towels had an old smell to them... almost moldy?? Not sure but they did not and were not fresh.

title: This hotel was below expectations
comment: The servoce at the hotel was below expectations

everyoneShouldKnow: Very Clean
title: Great Fun Hotel
comment: We stayed 1 night, love it here. Very Friendly staff. They did promise us chocolates and wine, but it was never delivered to our room. Little dissapointed, but overall a great place to stay. The front desk staff very nice, but they are understaffed I dont care for the front desk answering the phone and helping customers when customers are at the desk waiting for help. Jonny the bartender was awesomer, very friendly hard working man.

everyoneShouldKnow: Although the hotel is not new, the facilities and staff make it such a worthwhile place to stay!
title: Wonderful place to relax!
comment: What a terrific vacation! My husband and I had a four day weekend together enjoying our Club Floor upgrade and Gold status free internet. I stayed on for another 11 days on my own and my husband will rejoin me for my final weekend.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fantastic views and great beds
title: Birthday
comment: We come to stay here at least once a year for my birthday and the view ,hotel quality and people have always been great.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pet and Child-Friendly hotel in a fantastic location.
title: Excellent location, Dog and Family Friendly
comment: We have stayed here twice before and are planning a return vacation for June. We are thrilled that this is such a pet and child friendly hotel with an unbeatable location. They try to keep the dogs contained to a couple floors, as to not disturb other guests but still make us all feel welcome. And, while we are usually forced to sacrifice something to bring the dog, this place is clean, well-maintained and offers everything we could want for a family vacation. I'm looking forward to seeing what the renovations bring - the kids loved the old zero-entry outdoor pool and the indoor pool was great for cool or rainy days. The staff is usually responsive but not necessarily proactive (they are skimpy with room towels but will bring more if you ask and don't offer BPG extras/upgrades, etc.). If you have a dog, it can be challenging to arrange for maid service - it would be great if they offered to set an appointment time for cleaning pet rooms. And, it would be nice if they honored some of the other Grandbourne rate specials, especially for extended stays. Everything considered, for the price, location and amenities, we haven't found a better hotel in Virginia, Maryland or Delaware that better meets our family's needs for a great beach vacation. We are looking forward to our next visit.

title: Service beyond the call of duty
comment: I had a recent stay at the Belvoir San Diego and Marina for a conference. On my way back to Georgia, I realized that I had left my conference materials and a phone cord in my room. When I landed I gave the hotel a call. I spoke with a gentleman in the lost and found department. Without any hesitation, he said that once he checked the room in which I had been staying that he would give me a call back. Within 30 minutes, I had a return call saying that my items had been found and that he would make sure that they were mailed to me. He even asked if they needed to be sent overnight mail! I said no, that regular mail delivery was ok. By the end of the week, I had my items in hand. By far the friendliest staff of any hotel that I have stayed in! Plan to come back to San Diego later in the year for a family vacation and will definitely be staying at the Belvoir Marina!!!

title: An Average Stay
comment: I arrived at the end of March 2012 for a convention. My stay lasted 4 nights. I called the hotel from the airport to ask about a shuttle. The person seemed quite busy and abrupt with me. There was no hotel shuttle to/from the airport, but a pay shuttle service was available ($10 per person). Check-in went smoothly. The room was nice, and I felt very comfortable. One of the curtains was broken. Internet access could be paid for by the hour or the day; however, the hourly service wasnt working. In calling the front desk, I was told it hadnt been working for some time. I spoke with the staff 5 additional times during my stay. First, to ask about a shuttle or directions to the convention center. There was no shuttle, but the person gave me walking directions. She was polite. Second, to ask about how late the shuttle ran to/from the airport. The person at the desk was unsure, and had trouble flagging down another person who knew. This other person (a head bellhop? he seemed to be someone directing other employees) seemed very rushed and didnt seem to want to be bothered. His answer was quick and abrupt almost as if annoyed. Third, to ask about local coffee shops and restaurants. It took a while to get help because employees were joking around and talking with each other one of whom was the same gentleman who seemed annoyed at my shuttle schedule question. He walked away without a word and let someone else help me. The other two times were with maids. Both of them seemed very concerned with my overall comfort they were quite pleasant to talk to. I ate at the hotel restaurant my last night. Dinner and service were great!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is even better in person that you can imagine
title: Went for Paradise and found Heaven
comment: Truly an amazing hotel. My husband and I went to spend my birthday and our anniversary. We loved it. The pools, the room, the view, the food...everything was just amazing. We felt like we were at home. We came home wondering how long it would take us to financially afford bringing our kids back with us. :-) The activities at the hotel were awesome. I cant say enough great things. Centrally located with amazing views. Muhalo Belvoir Waikiki we love you!!!

title: Pretty cool place to stay
comment: The hotel is overall pretty nice. Room decor is cool but not over-the-top or anything. The interior design of this hotel is really neat! Hotel staff is professional yet friendly, as the staff at any hotel should be.

everyoneShouldKnow: Better hotel than its category.
title: Better than expected
comment: Having booked this hotel using a promotional offer that I could not refuse, I was not disappointed. Proximity to Balboa Park, Gaslamp, and the highway was great. The suites were a bit smaller than I was expecting but still ample for 2 people. Rooms were clean, well maintained. Free internet in lobby was great, as was the restaurant's daily breakfast - especially the omelettes. My only complaint is a common one - the cost for parking. All in all though, I'm somewhat surprised this is only a category 3 hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location to Bricktown
title: Dream turned into Disappointment
comment: I have dreamed about staying at the Belvoir in Bricktown our President of the United States Of America stayed there. I got what I thought was a great deal. I arrived at the hotel and was greeted by the attendant. We checked in we were given a room on the way up to the room I noticed the temp was rather hot when we arrived in the room it was miserable so we turned AC on high and went to dinner. We got to ride in a limo supplied by the hotel made us feel special. We was gone 3 1/2 hours when we returned to the room it was still on the warm side so I turned the AC on higher. Got ready for bed and thought I would watch some TV; however the remote would not work. Awoke at 4am in a sweat decided I couldn't take anymore so spoke with the gentleman at the front desk he told me to talk with management to see if they could make it right I called and asked to speak with the Manager I was given to a man that said his name was Corey no last name and I told him my story he said he would put a work order in to see if it needed repair. I would not recommend this specific hotel from my experience.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location if you're going to stay in Hollywood as it's close to many different attractions such as the Walk of Fame, Universal Studios theme park, and WB and Paramount studios
title: Great staff
comment: The hotel was as expected. The renovation shows. The lobby is sleek and modern, and though I was never in the hotel to enjoy it the main floor bar area was always a happening place. The rooms were noticeably renovated and comfortable. The staff was awesome. For the first few nights my Green Choice doorknocker (turning away maid service) was ignored, but each time I brought it up, the staff immediately added the bonus points to my BPG account. They brought up a fridge the moment one became available, and they let us use one of their landline phones to book several attractions in the area, rather than forcing us to go back to our room and pay $2 per local call to do it that way. And always with a friendly smile and a great attitude. The location of the hotel was great for us - close to Universal with a free shuttle, and close to a Metro station which provided easy access to Hollywood and also to downtown LA. I was very pleased with my stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay on the back side of the hotel, facing the pool and golf course. The front faces the parking lot a gets more sun.
title: Always Near Perfect
comment: This has long been a favorite resort of mine in the Phoenix area. It is just so nicely laid out and built for relaxation. I love the walking trail and use it every morning to start my day. The staff here is also about the friendliest you will find anywhere. They all go above and beyond to please the guests. The pool area is great for both kids and adults, and is so large that you never feel crowded. The 2 golf courses on site at Whirlwind Golf Club are outstanding and run by Troon Golf. The resort is a bit out of the way, south of Phoenix on the outskirts of Chandler, but it works for me. Every bit of civilization is just minutes away on Chandler Blvd, and Ray Road.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff, beautiful view of ocean, and convenient to other boardwalk activities.
title: Newly renovated room with view of beach.
comment: This specialty room had two queen beds and the decor was so restful that my guests and I wished we could stay longer. Since it's right on the beach, it's a perfect location for biking, rollerblading, etc. Although construction continued, it did not interfere with our enjoyment. We did not eat at the main dining room so cannot comment on the food. The fitness center was still under construction.

everyoneShouldKnow: people are great
title: Love the staff
comment: the staff is friendly and always knows my name..From Lisa's Wednesday nights in the club lounge to Olga at the front desk, to Alex and Doreen and Melissa they all do a great job making us comfortable . I can speak for the other regulars that we feel like home when we stay there.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great deal!
title: Hotel convenience and friendliness
comment: We checked into the hotel about 9 P.M. and were just overnight the night before flying out of Louisville for spring break. When we checked in, I asked the front desk attendant if she knew where there was a store close by that I could get some yogurt. She immediately went in the back and came out with yogurts for my family and myself.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is a two star hotel.
title: The carpet was filthy:(
comment: This hotel definately needs attention. The carpet was filthy! I walked around in my white socks and immediately were black underneath. The bathroom floor was sticky! Yuck! I was also charged when my room was prepaid and had to ask the front desk clerk to reverse the charges and he seemed bothered by my request.

everyoneShouldKnow: good all round
title: very nice hotel, good location, great club facilities
comment: Stayed in the club level and were delighted by the breakfast, evening supper and service provided there. The rooms were very comfortable, location excellent, the general feeling of being in a hospitable hotel environment.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great gift shop for sport card collecting fans.
title: Learned from my first stay
comment: Second times a charm as the saying goes. Went for a king bed on this stay and found the bed adequate. Staff was fantastic again. Club experience ok. Ask for a Club room would be my suggestion. Gift shop is a treasure of sport pictures with autographs. Pool is great, but loud construction in pool area during a Saturday stay was hard to believe was happening.

title: Overall Review
comment: Staff are nice and helpful. The food is not good but the location is close to other surrounding restaurants. The water is too soft but the beds are comfortable.

title: Diamond in the Rough
comment: Five weeks into a three month stay the ENTIRE staff has been more than accommodating. From the very first meeting with Lisa, Director of Sales, to the daily interaction in the club lounge with Alex and the rest of the attendants, my stay has certainly been a comfortable one to say the least. I look forward to finishing out my stay and returning again in the near future.

title: Comfortable, but too much construction
comment: Hammering and drilling started at 7:30 sharp every morning inside the hotel this weekend at a conference. Everything would have been great, but until they finish whatever they're doing, you won't be able to sleep past that, no matter how comfortable the bed is. Can't believe they start all that so early. Used the dry cleaning service in house..they over charged me and failed to refund me until i spoke to someone in person,then he wouldn't give me his name, only said he was the concierge...strange. The bed was great the room was super clean and they give you a free bottle of water in the fridge....seems rare these days.

title: Not so great
comment: I have stayed here numerous times. Most of the stays were good but I had issues on couple stays.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Club Lounge Service and Atmosphere
title: This hotel has excellent service in club lounge
comment: I was very pleased with the service I received from Ms. Jackie. She goes above and beyond to treat the people in the Lounge with great respect and in a friendly atmosphere. She is truly a great asset for the Belvoir Hotel.

title: Great rooms and pool area
comment: My family spent one award night at the end of our vacation at this hotel. The room was fantastic being a small suite and having a great balcony. My kids and I also loved the two big pools, game room and poolside bar. The location is central to Disney. The check-in staff and bartender were helpful and attentive. The only area for improvement was the food. We had a late dinner by the pool and the food was overcooked and barely edible. Overall, this hotel had excellent amenities and location given its value price. We will definitely look at returning.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you want a memorable stay, consider something else: El Convento in town was just beautiful (I had to stop by to look at it!)
title: Mediocre. Not recommended.
comment: Hotel was disappointing. Nothing to write about. Old construction. Management is keeping it up just about enough to keep it going. Staff are pleasant enough without being helpful. Its a cash cow with the hotel regularly going full, so there is no need to make much effort (probably thanks to its strategic location opposite the cruise ship docks.)

title: Great staff, hotel needs updating
comment: The staff was very friendly and helpfull. Hotel is in a great location. It just needs updating. The carpets were worn and dirty. The work out facility was not in a great location and was very tight.

everyoneShouldKnow: The food in the dining area was surprisingly good based on most hotels, which charge high prices but the quality is lacking.
title: This hotel is very nice!
comment: The service & amenities were first rate. The staff were very friendly and helpful. In addition, the location (waterside) was awesome!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Extraordinary Service
title: Best place to stay in LA/Pasadena area
comment: While the glow of a great vacation/stay in Pasadena is still very fresh, I'd like to tip my hat to some of the very best service I have received almost anywhere for anything in a very long time. The Staff at the Belvoir Pasadena was so exemplary, truly I was sad to leave to head home. That hasn't happened for longer then I can remember!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Mediocre
title: Belvoir Vistana Villages Orlando Needs Improvement
comment: Overall, this resort did not live up to expectations. Having stayed down the street at the Belvoir Vistana on numerous occassions, this resort was well below standards. Upon check in we informed the staff that we would need to have a late checkout (noon) upon departure. When we got to the departure date, we were informed that this is not possible. The staff was not very willing or knowledgeable about how to handle the situation. The walls/floors of the villa were very thin and you could hear everyone above and next to you. We complained to security about this, and there was little done. Overall, the resort did not meet expectations for a Belvoir/Grandbourne property. We have stayed in many of Grandbourne hotels/locations, but this did not meet standards.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's in a great location. Three blocks from the House of Blues and about 10 blocks from Little Italy.
title: This hotel has a great staff
comment: I have been in San Diego on business steadly for about 5 months. I can stay at several hotels but I choose this one first because the staff is exceptional.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its not worth staying.
title: Hotel is a Disappointment
comment: It all started with check-in. I had to ask for my gift. It was one drink for 2 gold members. Then the club loung offered very little in the way of night snacks. There was no one there to keep an eye on the food and when we arrived there was just a mess. We called down to tell them there was no food, and it took the 15 min to come check for themselves and another 1/2 to bring new food. The bed was very hard, and the AC didn't work right. We just stayed in Springfield last month and it was so much better for the same category of Hotel, and not much more in points. Fitness Center outside of hotel really defeats the purpose.

everyoneShouldKnow: exceptional manager
title: Manager of hotel exceptional
comment: The manager went out of his way to make our meeting and stay great. When my rental car would not start and it was impossible to get to the airport on time, he arranged for a van to get me there.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and wonderful staff
title: February/March 2012
comment: I stayed at this location twice, before and after a trip to the Dominican Republic. This hotel is a standout. At the beginning of the trip, once I had gotten thru security @LAX, at 5:30 am, I realized I had left a laptop computer in the room. In a panic, I called the hotel, explained my predicament, and was connected right away to the bellhop who had assisted me earlier that morning. Mr. Williamson checked my room, and sure enough found the laptop on the bed. I hopped back on the airport shuttle bus, went back to the Gateway, where Mr. Jorge (sorry I didn't get your last name) was waiting for me at the concierge desk with the laptop. I immediately hopped on to the same shuttle and got back in time to catch my flight to Miami. What a great staff!

everyoneShouldKnow: Location can't be beat!
title: Friendly staff - great location- modern look
comment: I don't travel much so I'm not too hard to impress. My kids and I used this as a stopover before hitting Six Flags in the morning.

everyoneShouldKnow: phone costs
title: extra expenses
comment: free parking is a plus and a charge for even 800 numbers is a real minus...even if one called 800 to book a Belvoir reservation. They need to drop this charge

everyoneShouldKnow: wifi is very expensive
title: wifi
comment: our stay was for only 1 night, we were just passing thru. We needed to have wifi for route directions, and was very suprised to hear there was a $9.95 charge per day. This was the highest charge I have ever paid anywhere in the world, and for that charge it was the slowest speed I had ever experienced

everyoneShouldKnow: The club lounge floor does not have a club lounge.
title: Club lounge does not exist
comment: When I used the extra starpoints to book a club lounge room I was told there was a club lounge with evening appetizers and refreshments and with morning breakfast.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location
title: Great Hotel. Scratchy sheets!
comment: We had a wonderful stay for the most part. The staff met all our needs, the room was great, the staff helpful and skilled. However the sheets on the beds are very scratchy and rough. I couldn't wait to get back to my own bed for a good night's sleep. Why would a hotel of clearly such high standards put cheap sheets on their beds?

title: Great hotel with one serious lapse
comment: I hate to criticize the hotel when so much about the facility is quite outstanding. The lapse involves insufficient telephone staff. In dialing the operator to call another hotel guest, I was put on an endless recording that someone would be with me shortly. After 5 minutes of waiting several times on different days, I simply gave up. In 45 years of frequent business travel, I have never experienced this problem anywhere. This needs the hotel management's attention.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location great
title: staff was outstanding
comment: we were their a week. The staff was great and explained and suggested things to do and tours how to go about getting to places and setting up car rental and pickup to airport when ready to leave. The only two things I would suggest is either bigger waste baskets or more of them, and microwave. Not always convenient to go out to get something and also saves a little money to be able to heat things you can pick up at store for late night or anytime. If staying a week it helps to be able to do things like that to save a little so you can do other things. But other than that we had a great time would stay again .

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent central location.
title: Great Location
comment: I recently stayed in this Belvoir for a girls trip to Seattle. I was very pleased with the location. We were able to walk to all the places downtown had to offer. We rented a car so that we could go do some sight-seeing outside of the city. The one complaint about this hotel I have is the 44.00 a day parking fee. This is steep. Next time I would not rent a car to avoid this charge. Guests of the hotel should pay a discounted rate.

title: Beautiful hotel, service needs work
comment: The hotel is in a good location, walking distance to Main Street in Santa Monica and the beach. The hotel itself is beautiful, modern and recently updated. We made an BPG reservation for a double room and due to status and the fact that we were traveling with kids were updated to a fabulous suite, newly renovated, modern with a king bed, pull out sofa, fabulous view and tiled jacuzzi on the balcony. The hotel has a nice pool right off the bar. It's a bit small with no bathrooms/changing rooms nearby (you need to walk through the bar to get there) but it's quite nice. While the hotel was lovely, service still needs work. The staff when we checked in was quite nice. Our room was upgraded but we were asked to wait until 5:30 for our room to be ready because the pipes in the original room we were slated for weren't working due to construction. We spent the afternoon at the pool but bar/food service was slow and not especially friendly. Net-net, we'd definitely go back and our experience wasn't nearly as bad as previous reviews but they hotel needs to focus on service in order to start earning better reviews overall.

everyoneShouldKnow: Kind staff
title: Question about curtains
comment: I was confused the room had only sheer curtains as the main curtains and the darken curtain were only on the side. So we felt we lacked privacy as we could see clearly across the hotel to the other side. Can you explain. You couldn't change your clothes in the room without exposure

everyoneShouldKnow: Horrible House Keeping
title: Disgusting
comment: I can't believe they let people stay at this place it is utterly filthy. I had to change rooms three times and each time the room was more disgusting. The sheets were not washed the last guest hair was still in the bed as well as in the shower. Nothing had been wiped down, I spent quite some time wiping the nightstand, table, bathroom, etc, down. The doors in room as well as in the hall way were heavily marked up and stained and looked very insecure. They were so many things wrong with this place if i mentioned them all it would take up the whole page. the short of it..... It is not worth it. The place is old and dirty, the pictures you see online are not what you will get save your money and nerves.

title: Needs a remodeling
comment: The rooms, hallways and lobby areas really need to be updated. The place looks old especially the rooms. The bathroom mirrors were not high enough for me to see my face while standing at the sink and there were big rust marks in the shower where a handicapped handle was removed. I thought the staff was really helpful and professional.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and rooms are nice!
title: I will be back!
comment: I loved staying here! The room was clean and spacious. The amenities were great, and I loved the service at the beach and pool area! Everyone was friendly and helpful.

title: Great location
comment: Rooms are on the smaller size. We had two full size beds in our room and they were small for two adults. The room for two adults and 2 children was tight.

title: Good staff Needs updated
comment: Great service! The pool area needs work though. Hot tub was no even full or hot and the pool needs work. Also need to invest in a new transport shuttle. It has no seat beats. Not very safe.

title: Good location, very helpful staff
comment: I stayed here couple of days ago, it is huge but nice property, convenient location to the convention center and close to Bourbon st. good platinum recognition on a very busy weekend with two big conventions in the city. I was upgrade to an executive suite on the 27th floor, club lounge selection are descent. I would definitely come back.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean, safe, comfortable hotel
title: Family friendly
comment: I have always enjoyed Belvoir properties, but this one exceeded my expectations. Beautiful view in a great location. Easy transportation, helpful front desk staff and great pool hours for the kids. Dinner at the hotel restaurant was fabulous..the waiter was so attentive and our meals were delicious. The walkway at the river was a great place to relax outside. Couldn't have been better.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's located next to Maryland's largest mall.
title: Great shuttle driver!
comment: I wanted to give a special shout-out to Greg, the driver of the hotel's shuttle. He was so professional, courteous, personable and accommodating. I chose your hotel for its close proximity to the offices of Baltimore Research and your free shuttle to and fro. And the shuttle service was beyond my expectations. Three cheers for Greg!

everyoneShouldKnow: parking expensive - double teaming with valet / near nothing need a vehicle to do anyting / slow kitchen, but good service
title: 3 night time share certificate
comment: good quality expensive food - very slow kitchen service and wait staff was forced to apologize. this was not a "friendly" long weekend, just expensive

everyoneShouldKnow: The carpets are filthy and management seems not to care.
title: Carpet in room is filthy
comment: The carpet in my room was absolutely filthy, with a large wet spot underfoot near the desk. Upon advising Guest Relations of the problem I was offered a free breakfast - not at all an acceptable response considering my concern was with the unhealthy condition of my room. As well, I could clearly hear entire conversations of the couple next door. I would never, ever recommend this hotel to anyone wishing a clean, quiet rest.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location. Renovation of hotel room and areas are great
title: Great hotel, need improvement at pool area
comment: I can say all was good, specially at front desk with Rep. Iglesias she took care of me and others while I was there with excellent service.

title: Nice experience overall!
comment: Great Mordern and CLEAN rooms, hotel staff was friendly and with the exception of one night in the hotel restaurant they kept us waiting at the table in a mainly empty place and forgot we were even there. The server did appologize and we where satisfied. The food is very good even if alittle pricey - Desserts are excellent!

everyoneShouldKnow: BPG Recognition was poor, the worst of any Grandbourne property I have stayed at.
title: I did not expect this poor BPG Recognition
comment: When you walk in the lobby, there is a big sign about the "new better" BPG program. I have stayed here once before the difference between the two stays was Night & Day.

title: Keep getting worse: stay at another property
comment: This was my second stay since last December. Requested for Gold BPG late checkout and got reluctant 2pm approval from front desk. Kept do not disturb tag on the door. Regardless, house cleaning knocking on the door starting at noon. Then even housekeeping manager waiting at the door from 1:30pm till I walk out at 1:50pm, giving the most nasty stare for not leaving early as if I was a criminal. The worst experience ever. Brought back the bad memory of seeing cockroaches in the bathroom last December stay. Mistake I will never make again. Highly recommend not staying at this property.

title: Highly Recommended
comment: I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Philadelphia, whether it be for business or fun. The rooms were clean, the location was perfect, and the entire staff most helpful with any request. I have read some other reviews, and disagree with most of their comments. I am the type of person that cares less about whether or not the bathtub is a jet-stream or if the room has fancy amenities. When I travel, I like to enjoy the city and the company I am with, and this hotel helped me do exactly that. The location provides easy access to all of Philadelphia, by foot or by subway. The staff go above and beyond by providing suggestions and answering any question that one may have, making sure your stay is enjoyable. Also, the room was perfect for a relaxing evening and quality sleep. I will definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff should at least try to meet the guest expectation.
title: Mr.Colonel
comment: Book on line for a king size bed but when I register at the front desk they told me that my room was ready. When I entered the room, the door was open and a towel on the front door. Suprisingly, instead of a king two small beds was selected for me. I went back to the lobby to clarify the misunderstand. The gentleman told me that is all they have. I told me that I was more willing to extra for a better room. He made wait for almost one hour. I check out at 10:15pm and requested for a receipt. He said that he cannot provide me one but he will e-mail it me. At 12:30am I received the invoice said the I checked out at 3:40pm.

everyoneShouldKnow: Helpful staff!
title: Great location and helpful staff!
comment: The location of this hotel is great! The subway station is directly behind the hotel and the staff gave such great directions regarding the subway that I felt like a pro by the time I left. The concierge was so helpful! I basically ran down a list of everywhere I wanted to go and he mapped it out for me. There was lots of shopping just a block from the hotel as well as some inexpensive pizza/bagel places next door.

everyoneShouldKnow: THe maintenace and food personnel were very pleasing and caring.
title: Gold Member
comment: The hotel was conveniently located for our needs as we need a place for 8 days. Upon arriving we were provided a room on the 6th floor which apparently did not have the AC unit running. We turned on the air unit only to have it blowing hot air although we had adjusted the temperature to 68 degrees. After about 30 minutes in the room only warm air was blowing, we called the front desk and advised them of our problem and they stated that it would be taken care of prior to our return that evening. My wife and I arrived around 3am that morning only to find the room at around 90 degrees plus. We contacted the front desk once again to voice our concerns and we were placed in another room. We adjusted the temperature in this room to 70 degrees only to find out that the hotel had control over the AC units independently and warm air was still blowing. We woke up about 10am that morning and my wife was showering, she rotated the water temperature handle only to have it get stuck on her in the hot mode and she quickly wrapped the shower curtain around her to avoid scorching. I immediately went to the front desk and asked for the manager as this was getting frustrating having issues with each room we were placed into. The manager sadly to say did not show any remorse to what was happening to us only that she would send someone to take care of it. The manager was a tad bit prudent so I contacted BPG customer service who managed to take care of the situation for us. We were provided with some hotel comps and a 7th floor room. I recommend this hotel seek better ways to improve its management staff as this was a true let down of the Belvoir Hotel name. I would not venture to come back to this hotel. By the way we moved 3 times in this hotel, my arms were getting rubbery from all the packing and unpacking.

everyoneShouldKnow: Valued Convienence
title: Great Stay
comment: I brought my "almost 5" year old grandaughter for a visit to Disneyland. The Belvoir Anaheim was a perfectly, affordable alternative the costly Disney properties. It has all the amentities kids and adults need. We loved the pool area. Every employee at the hotel was helpful and courteous and made us feel welcome.

everyoneShouldKnow: WiFi internet service is not free.
title: Great location. Get out of your room!
comment: The location is fantastic. I paid extra to stay in one of the newly renovated "upgrade" rooms. It was nicely furnished, meticulously clean, and wonderfully quiet. Even so, the upgraded room was small and the bathroom was very small - youll want to get out on the town as soon as possible. The staff accommodated my request for late arrival and late check out without hesitation. The elevators are amazingly fast.

everyoneShouldKnow: Follow up any promisses made.
title: Nice Stay, but...
comment: Booked a point stay here early April, was told the only rooms available were double bed club level and 5500 points. Got to the property and asked about a king and there was one available but it wasn't club level. Asked for the 1500 extra points to be refunded and told that would be done. However, the 1500 points never got posted. Attempted to contact property using their email link posted on their web page and no response. Contacted BPG and they adjusted my account within minutes! Never any response from the property.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location, mediocre room and service
title: Good location, Small Room
comment: Location is good - close to all downtown locations and cabs readily available.

title: This hotel has great access to UPenn
comment: This hotel was situated next to the UPenn campus so visiting the school is super easy. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful when answering all types of questions about the area. Garage attached to hotel very helpful in a city where parking is difficult. Rooms were clean and well stocked. Computer in each room with wireless access available too. If you have any "special" questions be sure and ask for Vinnie .... he is great!

everyoneShouldKnow: Quality of the facility and staff
title: Wonderful facility and staff
comment: Stayed in room 701. The air compressor for the AC unit was quite loud and needs to be examined. As usual everything , with this one exception, was marvelous. We always enjoy our visit to this facility.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very close to the airport. Nice location by the water.
title: Great Hotel
comment: Stayed one night pre cruise and was very happy with our room and the service from the front desk. Rooms are large and nicely laid out. (Bay Tower)

everyoneShouldKnow: Get a room facing the golf course, great view each morning.
title: Consitently good service
comment: This was my 5th stay at the Belvoir Miami Airport this year. Overall it was an excellent stay. The only issues I had were the lack of BPG recognition at check-in, I have been a platinum member for 2 years yet their computer system still has me as a gold member which requires me to alert them to my status so I can access the club lounge. Additionally, this is the first time I have stayed here that I was not put in an BPG Room. Not sure what happened but the room was nice only issue was not getting my bottled water everyday, but with club access it wasn't that big of a deal. The staff here do a great job for the most part. The valet and luggage service do a great job. The front desk staff could do a bit better, but overall it is a great hotel. I can't wait for the new club lounge to be finished.

everyoneShouldKnow: Never sign a contract, there are no queen size beds in the double rooms, no laundry room on site.
title: This hotel is disappointing
comment: The beds are small and the rooms have neither microwaves nor refrigerators. Beware of the Hot water-it gets very, very hot. This facility does not have a laundry room. During my visit, the elevator broke often. No towels were available in the pool area. The lower level staff is great, but the sales director & executives should get some customer service training. Because of them, I will never stay at a Belvoir again. They made me feel as if our group was an inconvenience to the Belvoir Cerritos.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great renovated public spaces and rooms
title: Excellent Renovation
comment: I used to stay at a competitor brand a couple exits off the airport due to the condition of the hotel, but now after the renvation this is my CLE hotel - I also stay here even if my business is downtown to stay loyal to the Grandbourne brand (I am multi-year platinum). Great job.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice Marina View
title: needs improvement
comment: 1. Front Desk failed to inform me about the "Make a Green Choice program", when I called them, it was too late to participate. They also put a flyer on the bed for the program, but failed to put it in both of my double beds. I happen to sleep on the other bed with no flyer.

title: Can't beat it for the price
comment: Great value! Hotel is clean, staff is helpful, rooms are comfortable. Great BPG recognition.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel was not BPG "friendly"
title: vacation visit
comment: We stayed at this hotel for one night upon arrival in Orlando for a week's vacation. We needed one night to stay over before checking into our resort. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were top notch. The fitness center was very clean and the equipment was in very good condition. The cleaning staff does a great job at this location. The staff in the lobby were not what I would expect from Belvoir. We were charged $20.00 to park our 2 vehicles after we already paid $20.00 for a "resort useage fee" as an BPG member. I asked why I was being charged $20 for parking after I already paid $20 for "resort useage fees", and they said, "That $20 gets you internet, a bottle of water and getting to use the fitness center." I then asked for a late checkout as an BPG member since we could not check into the resort until late afternoon. The lady at the counter told us she would allow us to stay until 2pm instead of the 3pm that I requested and said, "I am sure they will have a room available for you by then." I explained to her that the resort check-in was not until 4pm, and she said that 2pm was all she would do. They then de-activated our room keys at 12:00 noon. The hotel staff here seems to not want any business from BPG members the way we were treated. The hotel as a whole is very nice and a wonderful location, but if you are an BPG member, do not expect to receive a very warm welcome or any accomidation from this hotel. I was very disappointed and do not plan to return to this hotel because of it. This is the first Belvoir hotel that I have stayed at in 10 years that I was treated so unwelcomed by the staff and therefore by the company. I truely hope that this is not the "new" Belvoir experience since this hotel has just been upgraded and remodeled. I hope it is an exception to the norm in the future because we love Belvoir and use it often. If you are looking for a nice hotel and want to spend money on resort fees, parking, and renting pool chairs, this is the place to go. If you are looking for a hotel and trying to use BPG benefits, it is the wrong place to go. I really hope this hotel becomes more BPG friendly because based on our stay this week, it is not.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and do not wear jeans when checking into this hotel, business or professional attire is a must!
title: Hotel Recommendation
comment: My room had screws coming out of the lock on the door, out of the plate on the shower, and was surprised by the lack of conversation by the hotel staff. My co-worker & I felt like we were looked down upon and the hallways, well, I'm hoping it's being renovated. The location was great, as was the view, however, I will not stay at this hotel, especially having to pay $25.00 for parking.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor restaurant service / food
title: Unsatisfactory restaurant
comment: The Belvoir Suites at the Philadelphia Airport provided me a spacious and comfortable clean room. I have no complaints.

everyoneShouldKnow: hard to get to and staff is no help
title: not a business hotel/terrible shuttle service
comment: This hotel is located in the Washington DC suburbs and connects to the city via hotel shuttle. When I called I was told the shuttle operates every half hour up to 9:30 pm. When I arrived at the Greenbelt metro station, I called and was told that the next shuttle wasn't until 9:00. The driver arrived early, but told me that someone had scheduled pick up at 9:00 or he wouldn't be there at all, and we had to wait until 9:00 before he would drive me to the hotel. It took one hour to get from the metro stop to the hotel. Upon arrival, I asked about the shuttle in the morning and found out it was already booked and the earliest I could get a ride to the metro was 9:00. The manager promised that she would be there in the morning and would find a way to get me to the metro at 7:00. When I went down early (after checking out the club lounge with the worst breakfast options ever, and it didn't open until 6:30) the manager was not on premises and I ended up sharing a taxi with another stranded working guest and our own additional expense. If you need to go to work, this hotel will not be able to help you. There were a lot of visiting young people around and it seems to work for them. The room was actually very nice with standard good Belvoir bedding, but the service was terrible.

everyoneShouldKnow: IF YOU BOOK A ROOM DON'T BE SO SUPRISED IF THEY DO NOT HAVE THE EXACT ROOM AVALIABLE.
title: THE HOTEL STAY WAS GREAT BUT...
comment: I BOOKED A 2 NIGHT STAY IN JACUZZI ROOM WITH THE PAYMENT OF A GIFT CERT. WHEN I ARRIVED THEY INFORMED ME THAT THEY HAD NO JACUZZI ROOMS AVALIABLE. I WAS VERY UPSET, SO HE UPGRADED ME TO A 2 BEDROOM SUITE. I DID NOT NEED A 2 BEDROOM SEEING THAT IT WAS JUST MY HUSBAND & I. HE SAID THAT WAS THE ONLY THING HE COULD DO, HE WAS RUDE. THE ROOMS WERE VERY CLEAN BUT NOT COMFORTABLE !ALTHOUGH I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL, THEY JUST AGGRIVATED ME VERY MUCH. I WOULD NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL AGIAN. THE POOL & GAME ROOM WAS GREAT !

everyoneShouldKnow: Bring a mini vac.
title: Disappointing, not a great value
comment: I checked in late and found a pair of dirty underwear in the bathroom and pretzels on the floor. I was too tired to deal with it that night. I indicated that I did not need fresh linens each day, but at most hotels they will still take out the trash and straigten up. Nope, had to take out my own trash, clean up the pretzels, etc. I was pretty busy, so thankfully did not spend much time at the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful hotel and Excellent service
title: Excellent Hotel !
comment: The hotel and staff were excellent in all area's. Best service we have ever received at any hotel, staff went out of their way to satisfy our needs, especially Vince at the front desk! I do agree with some of the other reviews that the water pressure could be much better in the shower. We will be back!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: It nickels and dimes you for services that would be complimentary at other hotels.
title: Not as luxurious as titled.
comment: I felt that there were some good qualities, but I must admit that it did not live up to my expectations as a frequent traveler with discriminating tastes. I felt the staff were not very friendly. They nickeled and dimed me for WIFI and parking. They did not have room accommodations, such as a microwave or any extra outlets for my electronics; I had to unplug lamps. I must admit that I will look elsewhere during my next trip to Anchorage...disappointing. Especially with Belvoir being my first choice in hotels.

title: Front Desk
comment: Associates need to be more Friendly, it was OK stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: The water slide is a lot of fun for all Young and Old!
title: Great service and amenities
comment: We came to Phoenix for an event and decided to pick this hotel based on the amenities. We found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. The water slide was a blast, and the food was delicious

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a big place!
title: Great staff!
