comment: The staff gets an A+! Parking is convenient as there's a parking garage connected to hotel. The hotel's interior could use some upgrades...new carpet, updated bathrooms, decorating etc. There are currently some renovations underway, but I'm not sure what exactly they are. With that said, this would be a very nice place to have a reunion, pageant, reception, etc.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean, Quiet, Comfortable, but unreliable Wi-Fi is a hinderance
title: Decent Hotel. Wi-Fi was Sub Par
comment: The hotel was decent. Comfortable, Clean Room. Nice bed. Nice Flat Screens in the rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great gym
title: Pleasant stay
comment: Nice building, good location, excellent gym, friendly staff

everyoneShouldKnow: don't expect anything special....which is sad for a Belvoir property
title: Not a Happy experience
comment: Receptionist unhelpful.- can't give me a straight answer about where to park ("anywhere - it's all the same"), nor a clarification on what/where the "Club floor" is ("it's the Club floor"). I requested a Non-smoking Kind bed, with NO down bedding. Room reeked of smoke and there was down bedding. Told there wasn't any other rooms available - then (after an hour and half) they "found" one two doors down. Spent the night under 2 sheets and a TWIN blanket because there were NO non-down bedspreads?? The maid was the only helpful person.

everyoneShouldKnow: New wifi and parking charges.
title: Beware of new charges
comment: I visit Dallas monthly and almost always stay at this Belvoir. While the new remodel of the lobby is very nice, the rooms are unchanged and they now charge $10 to park overnight (free prior to remodel) and $12.95 for wifi PER 24 hours(also used to be free). When will hotels stop nickel and diming their guests? There is NO OTHER parking option at this hotel so why do they not just include that in the price?? I will not return on principle alone.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great pool and fitness center.
title: Bumpy stay
comment: Have stayed here several times due to the great location and pool/fitness facilities, but this stay was a bumpy one.

everyoneShouldKnow: Near I95 the airport and restaurants. Free parking.
title: Excellent Service
comment: I highly recommend this property based on its location and well trained staff. The rooms are larger than average and the front desk, restaurant and club lounge staff are very good. The staff are as good here as any of the Grandbourne properties I have stayed at around the world.

title: Great hotel
comment: Great hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Great location for USMLE Step 2 CS test taking.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hospitality
title: Great vacation
comment: We had such a great stay at the hotel can't wait to return. Staff so friendly and helpful. Thanks to Shannon and Miles for over the top service.

everyoneShouldKnow: La informacion sobre el trasporte al aeropuerto es inexacta
title: Transporte aeropuerto informaci󮠩nexacta
comment: El transporte del y hacia el aeropuerto se debe solicitar la pagina web anuncia que el servicio del y hacia el aeropuerto se presta cada media hora.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is extremely dark.
title: too much disappointment
comment: We have probably stayed at this hotel 6 or 7 times and I think it is time to move on. Upgrades based on gold status seem to have disappeared. We stayed two straight weekends in April and did not receive an upgrade during either stay. One of the few Grandbournes properties where this seems to be a problem and not nearly one of the better hotels or locations, so not sure why this is such a problem. The staff was very nice except for one young lady at the front desk who lectured me on self-parking. Service was good at the bar the first night, but the second night when it was crowded, we left after 20 minutes at a table when the waitress just walked by ignoring us. Bell service and the parking team were great, and through no fault of theirs, self-parking was not available either Saturday as there was an event each week. One week the parking was waived, the other it wasn't. Finally, I was charge full point value while the fitness center was closed and there was construction next to the hotel and work going on in the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is the only hotel you should consider staying at when in Waikiki
title: We Will Be Back
comment: Boy did we have a great time. You know a hotel must be good when they are booked out on certain dates you want to stay there. Our family of 4 wanted to stay 12 nights but it was Easter so probably a busier time. At first there was a period of 3 nights we would have to go and stay elsewhere because they were fully booked but I checked a couple of times and in the end I was able to get the whole 12 nights here and I am so glad. We had 2 ocean front rooms booked so the teenagers could have thier own room and we all had a little more space from each other. We had an interconnecting door which was great because we only closed it at bedtime and every other time we were in the rooms it was like we were all together anyway. We honestly could not complain about anything during our stay. We were happy with the rooms on the 19th floor overlooking the infinity pool which was great. The ocean looks so blue and amazing when you look out. At night you can kick back on the balcony and listen to the music below or watch the firedancer show. Beds are so comfy and the hotel staff are so friendly always saying aloha as you pass them in the hallway. The staff at the travel desk are so helpful in booking or reconfirming any day tours. We loved the fact that the hotel was right on the beach and also so close to walk to the shops. This was our first overseas holiday and I am so glad we chose to spend all our nights at the Belvoir Waikiki. Make sure you try the freshly baked cookies from the cookie shop. We were there nearly everyday as we fell in love with the choc chip cookies. After seeing where some hotels are located in proximity to the beach and shops I know that I booked the best place to stay. We really could not fault our stay in any way and we know we will return for another relaxing break in the near future.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great overall atmosphere!
title: Overall perfect vacation
comment: We have never been as pleased with everything as much as we were here! The staff was great the hotel was great and very clean. We were treated like family and were remembered when we came through the lobby. Key West in general is just a great vacation and the Belvoir has the best location. The shuttle service is a great plus, and yes Mr. Ed is a sweetie. Make your next vacation at the Belvoir in Key West. You won't be dissapointed!

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean and comfortable
title: First Stay
comment: This was our first stay and we could not be more pleased. Very comfortable bed, nice pillows, modern furnishings, Starbucks coffee in the room. Excellent dining and a mall is located across the parking lot. Excellent all the way around.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor internet service
title: Internet Service
comment: I have stayed here 8 times over the past 2 months. Overall good experience. 2 major issues.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location
title: Good stay, Thanks!
comment: Sometimes it is just the little details that make all the difference. I stayed here for one night while passing through Philly, and the stay was good. I would have rated it a 4/5, front desk people were good, valet door people were great,club lounge was ok (could use improvement) but what converted it to a five was the housekeeping staff who all greated me very warmly (5 or 6 of them) the next morning and again as I was leaving. It left me witha smile on my face for the rest of the day. Thanks!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is the best hotel near Winter Park Hospital
title: understanding/very helpful
comment: stayed there after father's surgery and everyone very helpful

title: Great Weekend Getaway
comment: The room was very spacious and well laid-out. The bed was amazingly comfortable, though the pillows were not. The bathroom was very dark, but really that was the worst part of the room. All of the staff that we dealt with were very courteous and helpful. If shopping is your thing (it's not mine) then the location is great. We stayed in the whole weekend and it was a very relaxing atmosphere.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent Staff
title: Excellent Hotel & Staff
comment: I prefer this hotel in the Louisville area. It is on the other side of the river, has great views and the staff is one of the best! Highly recommended - you will not be let down.

everyoneShouldKnow: Really close to airport (good thing).
title: Very nice stay
comment: everything was just fine, staff great, easy over to airport.

everyoneShouldKnow: Avoid it
title: Disappointing
comment: Beds too soft; phone was disconnected. Promised free internet was not fulfilled and the actual internet was sluggish. Parking lot was crowded.

title: Platinum Travelers Beware
comment: Subpar room upgrades (mine was more like an upgraded closet) and wifi that crawls slower than dial up.

everyoneShouldKnow: Newly renovated hotel with outstanding staff and Management, great midtown location
title: Hotel is always prefect
comment: I'm at Grandbourne hotels every week in some part of the US. This hotel is consistently friendly, extremely attentive actually often at check in remembers my name, goes beyond the call to make sure my stay is the best possible

everyoneShouldKnow: Very quite location with easy access to freeways.
title: Amazing hotel!
comment: I booked this hotel for a business trip and expected a fairly standard hotel room, but I couldn't have been more wrong! Room was amazing, from the full kitchen with everything you could ever think to need to the 2 person Jacuzzi tub! Staff was great the whole time and went above and beyond. There was even a wine tasting in the evening one day. If you are looking for a nice quiet place to stay that is just a short drive to some great hot spots and easy freeway access this hotel is for you!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for time square or central park.
title: good except for house keeping and street noise
comment: The room was small, but typical for NYC. The bed was comfortable. Good choice of TV channels and nice large flat screen. Great location within walking distance to alot. The shower didnt have much pressure. I was on the 14th floor and the street noise was very, very loud. I was woken up in the middle of the night several times. The windows need to be updated cancel out the noise. The cleaning staff left my dirty sheets in my room on the ground. I travel weekly for work and have never had that happen before.

title: great club lounge
comment: Excellent service, location and comfort.

everyoneShouldKnow: Dumpy
title: Dumpy property with capital D, but great staff
comment: I'm an BPG Platinum and spend half my year in hotels. Like many others, I use all those earned points to travel with my wife and kids. And just like others the last thing I want when I am with the family is to experience 3rd rate properties. Belvoir Baltimore City Center hotel falls right into that category.

title: Paper Walls
comment: When I made my reservation I requested a quiet room. Did the same at check in. Rude guests ran screaming the halls that night. Get togethers in adjacent rooms sounded like they were in YOUR room. Not the Belvoirs fault. What is the Belvoirs fault is their paper wall construction. You will hear EVERYTHING. They were unable to remedy the situation after three calls to the front desk. Packed my bags and left for home at !:30 AM!!!!!!!!!!!You'd be nuts to stay here. P.S. The beds were nice. Furniture was stained----ughhhhh. You can do far better for less.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location
title: Maintaining Belvoir Standards
comment: This is an excellent Belvoir. Clean, quiet, and great location.

everyoneShouldKnow: The room was not very clean and The parking was bad at night. No space at all.
title: Room was NOT very clean at all
comment: I stayed at this hotel on 4/10 to 4/12 and the room set up was really nice with bunk bed for the kids. However, the room was not clean at all. The room's air was stale, the sofa had stained all over and dusts in the room too. The carpet was not clean either. The AC make so much noise that would wake you up middle of night. No air in the bathroom and no vent too. The only thing that was good is that it is close to Disney Downtown. That's about it.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect anything other than a bed.
title: Staff is nice, but this hotel is below average
comment: I was really disappointed in the hotel. We planned to work out at the gym, but when we arrived we were told it was closed for repairs. Then, we could not eat lunch at the hotel, as the restaurant was closed. The front desk could not change a $20 bill, there wasn't any place in the hotel to get or buy a bottle of water, when I went downstairs to eat dinner, the restaurant was closed except for 5 little tables in the bar, which was dark, noisy and depressing, so I could not eat dinner. I left a note on the bed asking the maids to change my linens, but they didn't do it, they just made up the bed with the same sheets. I asked for a shower cap, but they didn't have any. I felt like I was staying at a cheap freeway motel that didn't have any amenities. The room key was suppose to let me in and out of the parking lot but every time except one, it didn't work and I had to call the valet to have him open the gate. I paid a lot per night and I feel very ripped off. As a premiere Grandbourne member, who travels a great deal, I expected much more from this hotel. I sent two emails to the manager but kept getting form letters back, and I have not been contacted with my concerns. One positive note, the staff were all very nice.

title: Nice. Good location.
comment: This is a nice hotel. I believe it was recently renovated as everything was very new and modern and upgraded. The LCD fireplaces were a bit odd... But in any case, it's quite a big complex and at the time of my stay, there was a cat show going on so it was very busy. Staff seemed to be able to keep up well with the revolving door.

everyoneShouldKnow: The beds must have like magic poppy dust in them, you never wanna get out of bed!'
title: Slept like a baby!!
comment: Only ONE complaint , from the time I stepped off the elevator onto the third floor, untill the end of my stay (2) days.. The hall ways smelled like you were walking past a really smelly dumpster. It was just odd. Other than that everything was great!!!

title: It was a good stay!
comment: I stayed at this location because my family and I were moving to Houston TX from Woodbridge VA and that was our resting stop. So, after driving for 12+ hours with an infant it was a little frustrating to find the guest services counter since there were very little signs. After I was checked in the room I gave my son a shower and the tub was clogged from before and the toilet was used( someone forgot to flush)!!!!! Well, I called the FD and resolved the problem. The next day I got a bill for $45.00 even though I used my Grandbourne points. I got charged $13.00 to make a call to another state even though the guest service agent told me it was going to be $2.00 for the initial call and then some cents per min after an hour. This is a little frustrating but oh well!

everyoneShouldKnow: convenience and cleanness
title: great staff and great experience
comment: I stayed Belvoir downtown Atlanta for business and it was a great experience. Restaurant was nice and deli was convenient. Staff members were always kind and nice and room was very clean. Best part was sitting in the hot tub at night with moon and stars after long day. I definitely recommend this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Difficult to access in light of construction
title: Disappointing facilities
comment: I stayed at this Sharaton while attending a recent conference. Although I very much appreciated the free wifi, I was quite disappointed in the facilities. First, the area around the hotel is under massive construction, making access to te hotel from the highway darn near impossible. My cab driver spent so much time driving around looking for some secret back entrance that my cab bill from the airport was almost as much as my nightly rate. I expressed my frustration to the desk clerk, and she conveyed a sense that she could not have cared less. When I got to my room, the sink was completely cracked. It was as if someone had smashed it with a heavy object. I could see this at a bargain basement brand hotel, but not at a Grandbourne property. I expect better.

everyoneShouldKnow: Based on everything one looks for in a hotel, we felt welcomed and valued as a customer. The staff wants to please their guests and they certainly did so.
title: An excellent visit
comment: I echo the comments of the last two writers. The location, the facilities, the staff, the service, the cleanliness and the club lounge were all excellent and exceeded our expectations and our experience at other hotels. We come to NY often and this was our first stay at this hotel. We will return to NY next weekend, had reservations in a different hotel and changed them so that we will stay at this hotel again. We enjoyed it very much.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly staff
title: Nice Hotel
comment: Nice hotel. Friendly staff. would stay at this location again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Even the housekeeping staff are expected to provide excellent customer service.
title: Friendly, helpful staff
comment: When I checked in, they let me add another person to the room and changed the room type, with friendliness and ease. The workout room had good equipment and amenities. Housekeeping staff that was on the floor when I checked in was very helpful when the room's door wouldn't fully open. Very pleased with every employee I encountered during the stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: The $25 upgrade to the Club floor is worth every penny
title: Awesome!
comment: Wouldn't change a thing about this place. Nicest staff and cleanest hotel I have experienced in quite some time....

title: Poor facilities
comment: Logging onto the network took significant amount of work. Their systems were having issues. After calling the front desk who was unhelpful, I called Tech Support directly. Took 30 minutes to get connected. I was charged $2.10 for toll-free phone calls. There was no placard or notification that I would be charged. Other hotels in the nearby area allow for free calls. In the morning, I was locked out of my room after going to the gym, and complaining about my bill. Very frustrating.

title: April 2012 - Phoenix
comment: Thank you Belvoir Downtown Phoenix, I attended a conference held at your hotel and from Tom at the front desk to checkout the STAFF is great. It was a pleasure to stay and look foward to being back if I need a hotel in Phoenix again

everyoneShouldKnow: Wonderful atmosphere
title: First unsatisfactory stay at a Belvoir
comment: I am sorry to say, this was my first time staying at a Belvoir where I did not go home feeling refreshed. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean, etc.... I was woken up throughout the night and extremely early every morning to a sound comparable to a jet engine. Every time the person next to us (maybe above us) used the water, it sounded like we were ready to take off on an airplane. Please check into this, as we love the Belvoir! We stayed in room #2417. Also, I feel as though $5.32 is outrageous for a 12 oz. can of coke. You should have a mini fridge in each room to give your guests the choice of purchasing your overpriced items or bringing their own. I also think that $14 for a glass of white wine is ludicrous (at the downstairs bar). These prices only make staying at a hoetel unattainable to some. It's no wonder I only can afford to do it through the company I work for. My husband and I would never be able to afford it otherwise, and we're a middle class working couple who need to get away sometimes! I'm sorry to say all of this, but I'm hoping it will help you make some positive changes for the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean Hotel, Competent Staff.
title: Staff was fenominal
comment: Jorge, the Lobby Ambassador, was a terrific host and very well informed. He was one of several employees who were warm and friendly and extremely approachable. Kudos to the GM for a staff well trained.

title: Disappointing
comment: Great location but....The room, although labeled as an upgrade, was smaller than most European rooms--made it exceptionally crowded for the three folks we had there--one of which was a child. Recommend making this a "King" room. The sound from the adjacent guest room was clearly (and annoyingly) loud--even though they didn't seem to be unusually loud themselves--just the room wasn't insulated very well. The club room was the least maintained of any I've experienced in a while--that may be due to some guest families spending a great deal of time there. I stayed there on "points" but in general I wouldn't recommend the experience to anyone else--especially for business trips.

title: ABOVE AND BEYOND!!!
comment: the staff was really great. the suite i got was really beautiful. the best i've seen so far!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff! Pet-friendly.
title: Professional staff and very pet-friendly!
comment: All of the staff was helpful, friendly, and professional. Grounds were well-maintained, room was spacious and clean, furnishings were nicely designed, and building was secure. Overall, great experience! A special thanks to Jaime at the hotel lounge -- exceptional service, very courteous, and beyond pleasant!

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms near Houston or St. Mary's streets are noiser. Request a room inside for a more quiet sleep. View isn't as nice but you really can't appreciate the local architecture unless you are outside. If bathroom size is important to you be sure to note this on your reservation. Most are decent sized but I did have one with a closet sized bathroom. However, the staff moved me to another room with minimal fuss.
title: True San Antonio Experience
comment: When you travel for work and stay at chains you sometimes wake up and forget what city you are in. Not so with the Gunter. This is a great historic hotel with uniquely decorated rooms. The staff is consistently friendly, efficient and ready to assist with whatever you may need. Because of this I frequently stay at the Gunter when in town for business, Fiesta events, or concerts at the Majestic and Empire theaters. All are within walking distance and you avoid the hassle of post event traffic. Plus you can grab a quick nightcap at Barrons which has a beautiful antique bar.

everyoneShouldKnow: Comfort and Ambience
title: Excellent Accommodations
comment: The rooms were lovely and large. Very, comfortable with wonderful staff at every stage of my stay. Food was very good. For those who also wish to add a visit to Disneyland, it is a short walk and easily done.

everyoneShouldKnow: Prepare to wait 45 minutes for your car at the parking garage
title: Nice but please ready
comment: All in all, had a good stay in this nice hotel, but must make the following comments

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location close to Downtown Disney.
title: Nice hotel and location...
comment: The hotel was definitely a giant leap above the Safari hotel. The beds are very comfortable and the decor is much nicer. The pool areas are also very nice. The resort and parking fees are frustrating though.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms and Shuttle need improvement
title: Dated Room
comment: We stayed at this Belvoir because it is close to Manhattan and free shuttle to the train station. As requested, I was given a higher floor room also with a great view (free upgrade). The hotel staff is great. One of my concern was that the carpet was really old in our room. This hotel badly needs some renovations.

title: Very Nice Stay
comment: Good location, helpful, efficient staff;

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is not knowledgable about gold status, amenities (shuttle and laundry), local area
title: Nice rooms, horrible staff and services
comment: I am a gold member and for 2 separate stays (for 8 nights total), they NEVER recognized my gold status or gave me my gold rewards (no 250 points, no free drink, no free internet - even after requested). They told me a shuttle was available and then gave me trouble about using it (particularly after I called to confirm they had a schedule). Simply horrible. I would never stay at this hotel ever again. After the first horrible stay, I almost cancelled my second reservation the week following. Instead, I decided to give them another chance, BIG mistake.

title: Another good stay
comment: I have stayed at many hotels around the DC area. I booked again at this hotel and was again pleased.

title: Great Hotel for Working Needs
comment: The staff at the hotel was so accommodating, friendly and fufilling all your needs. The maid tried to keep the room very clean and the linens fresh.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel was very nice and staff was exceptional.
title: This Hotel Met My Expectations
comment: Stayed at this hotel on April 25 and April 27th. The hotel was very nice and the staff was exceptional. Will gladly stay at this hotel when I'm visiting Ft Lauderdale and will reccommend this hotel to family and friends.
